55bf43cb-7a16-4f2a-9fd7-20a3f0169077.content: Scope of application of the law

pt_1.content: This law applies to the processing of personal data by

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_1.spt_1.content: public bodies of the federal government,

spt_2.content: public bodies of the federal states, insofar as data protection is not regulated by federal state law and insofar as they

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_b.content: act as bodies for the administration of justice and are not involved in administrative matters.

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_1.spt_0691762c-1ad4-4.content: 2For non-public bodies, this Act shall apply to the wholly or partially automated processing of personal data and the non-automated processing of personal data which are or are to be stored in a filing system, unless the processing is carried out by natural persons exclusively for the performance of personal or family activities.

pt_2.content: Other federal legal provisions on data protection shall take precedence over the provisions of this Act. If they do not regulate a matter to which this Act applies, or do not regulate it conclusively, the provisions of this Act shall apply. The obligation to maintain statutory confidentiality obligations or professional or special official secrets that are not based on statutory provisions shall remain unaffected.

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_3.content: The provisions of this Act shall take precedence over those of the Administrative Procedure Act insofar as personal data is processed in the investigation of the facts.

pt_4.content: This Act shall apply to public bodies. It shall apply to non-public bodies insofar as

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_4.spt_1.content: the controller or processor processes personal data in Germany,

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_4.spt_2.content: the processing of personal data takes place in the context of the activities of a domestic establishment of the controller or processor, or

spt_3.content: the controller or processor does not have an establishment in a Member State of the European Union or in another State party to the Agreement on the European Economic Area, but falls within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC ( ) (OJ L 119, 4.5.2016, p. 1; L 314, 22.11.2016, p. 72; L 127, 23.5.2018, p. 2).

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_4.spt_0b1bce99-f06b-4.content: 3If this Act does not apply in accordance with sentence 2, only Sections 8 to 21, 39 to 44 shall apply to the controller or processor.

p_1.cpt_1.art_1.pt_5.content: The provisions of this Act shall not apply insofar as European Union law, in particular Regulation (EU) 2016/679 as amended, is directly applicable.

pt_6.content: In the case of processing for purposes in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the contracting states of the Agreement on the European Economic Area are equivalent to the Member States of the European Union. Other countries are considered third countries in this respect.

pt_7.content: For processing for the purposes referred to in Article 1(1) of the Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data by competent authorities for the purposes of the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offenses or the execution of criminal penalties, and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive (OJ L 119, 4.5.2016, p. 89), countries associated with the implementation, application and development of the Schengen acquis shall be treated in the same way as Member States of the European Union. Other states are considered third countries in this respect.

pt_8.content: Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Parts 1 and 2 of this Act shall apply mutatis mutandis to the processing of personal data by public bodies in the context of activities that do not fall within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the Directive, unless otherwise provided for in this Act or another law.

p_1.cpt_1.art_2.pt_1.content: Public bodies of the Confederation are the authorities, the organs of the administration of justice and other institutions of the Confederation organized under public law, the federally directable corporations, the institutions and foundations under public law and their associations, irrespective of their legal form.

p_1.cpt_1.art_2.pt_2.content: Public bodies of the federal states are the authorities, the organs of the administration of justice and other institutions organized under public law of a federal state, a municipality, an association of municipalities or other legal entities under public law subject to the supervision of the federal state, as well as their associations, irrespective of their legal form.

pt_3.content: Associations under private law of public bodies of the Federal Government and the Länder that perform public administration tasks are deemed to be public bodies of the Federal Government, irrespective of the participation of non-public bodies, if

p_1.cpt_1.art_2.pt_3.spt_1.content: they operate beyond the borders of one country or

p_1.cpt_1.art_2.pt_3.spt_2.content: the Federal Government holds an absolute majority of the shares or is entitled to an absolute majority of the votes.

p_1.cpt_1.art_2.pt_3.spt_0914d086-d4d8-4.content: 2 Otherwise, they are considered public bodies of the federal states.

pt_4.content: Non-public bodies are natural and legal persons, companies and other associations of persons under private law, insofar as they do not fall under paragraphs 1 to 3. If a non-public body performs sovereign tasks of public administration, it is a public body within the meaning of this Act.

pt_5.content: Public bodies of the Federal Government shall be deemed to be non-public bodies within the meaning of this Act insofar as they participate in competition as companies under public law. For the purposes of this Act, non-public bodies shall also include public bodies of the federal states insofar as they participate in competition as companies under public law, implement federal law and data protection is not regulated by state law.

f22ce86c-6ce2-4497-b686-da030eb11ee8.content: Legal basis for the processing of personal data

78c4fbc3-01e3-452c-a679-0d0909f2e6b4.content: Processing of personal data by public authorities

p_1.cpt_2.art_3.pt_1.content: The processing of personal data by a public authority is permitted if it is necessary for the performance of a task carried out by the controller or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

5c1d10f1-01e5-458b-8ae9-8ebd04f60d7a.content: Video surveillance of publicly accessible areas

pt_1.content: The observation of publicly accessible rooms with optical-electronic equipment (video surveillance) is only permitted if it

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_1.content: to fulfill the tasks of public authorities,

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_2.content: for the exercise of domiciliary rights or

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_3.content: to safeguard legitimate interests for specifically defined purposes

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_5c737346-2c5f-4.content: is necessary and there are no indications that the interests of the data subjects worthy of protection prevail. 2In the case of video surveillance of

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_4.content: publicly accessible large-scale facilities, such as in particular sports, assembly and entertainment facilities, shopping centers or parking lots, or

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_5.content: Vehicles and publicly accessible large-scale public rail, ship and bus transportation facilities

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_1.spt_2f1faf93-ce7f-4.content: the protection of the life, health or freedom of persons residing there is considered a particularly important interest.

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_2.content: The fact of the observation and the name and contact details of the person responsible must be made recognizable by appropriate measures at the earliest possible stage.

pt_3.content: The storage or use of data collected in accordance with paragraph 1 is permitted if it is necessary to achieve the purpose pursued and there are no indications that the interests of the data subjects worthy of protection prevail. Paragraph 1 sentence 2 applies accordingly. They may only be further processed for another purpose if this is necessary to avert threats to state and public security and to prosecute criminal offenses.

pt_4.content: If data collected through video surveillance is assigned to a specific person, there is an obligation to inform the data subject about the processing in accordance with the and Regulation (EU) 2016/679. applies accordingly.

p_1.cpt_2.art_4.pt_5.content: The data must be deleted immediately if it is no longer required to achieve the purpose or if the interests of the data subjects worthy of protection prevent further storage.

4de67d45-bd48-4fcc-bbf9-64f27828dcc8.content: Data protection officers of public authorities

pt_1.content: Public bodies shall appoint a data protection officer. This shall also apply to public bodies pursuant to paragraph 5 that participate in the competition.

p_1.cpt_3.art_5.pt_2.content: A joint data protection officer may be appointed for several public bodies, taking into account their organizational structure and size.

pt_3.content: The data protection officer shall be appointed on the basis of his or her professional qualifications and, in particular, the expertise he or she possesses in the field of data protection law and practice, as well as on the basis of his or her ability to perform the tasks set out above.

p_1.cpt_3.art_5.pt_4.content: The data protection officer may be an employee of the public body or perform his or her duties on the basis of a service contract.

p_1.cpt_3.art_5.pt_5.content: The public body shall publish the contact details of the data protection officer and share these details with the Federal Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information.

p_1.cpt_3.art_6.pt_1.content: The public body shall ensure that the data protection officer is properly involved in all matters relating to the protection of personal data at an early stage.

pt_2.content: The public sector body shall support the Data Protection Officer in the performance of his or her tasks in accordance with , by providing the resources and access to personal data and processing operations necessary for the performance of those tasks and by providing the resources necessary to maintain his or her expertise.

pt_3.content: The public sector body shall ensure that the data protection officer does not receive any instructions regarding the performance of these tasks when carrying out his or her duties. The data protection officer shall report directly to the highest management level of the public body. The data protection officer may not be dismissed or discriminated against by the public body for the performance of his or her duties.

pt_4.content: The dismissal of the data protection officer is only permissible in corresponding application of the German Civil Code. Termination of the employment relationship is not permitted unless there are facts that entitle the public body to terminate the employment relationship for good cause without observing a notice period. After the end of employment as a data protection officer, termination of the employment relationship within one year is inadmissible unless the public body is entitled to terminate the employment relationship for good cause without observing a notice period.

pt_5.content: Data subjects may consult the data protection officer on all matters relating to the processing of their personal data and the exercise of their rights under Regulation (EU) 2016/679, this Act and other data protection legislation. The data protection officer is obliged to maintain confidentiality about the identity of the data subject and about circumstances that allow conclusions to be drawn about the data subject, unless he or she is released from this obligation by the data subject.

pt_6.content: If, in the course of his or her work, the data protection officer becomes aware of data for which the management or a person employed by the public body has a right to refuse to give evidence for professional reasons, the data protection officer and the employees reporting to him or her shall also have this right. The person who has the right to refuse to testify for professional reasons shall decide on the exercise of this right, unless this decision cannot be made in the foreseeable future. Insofar as the data protection officer's right to refuse to testify extends, his or her files and other documents are subject to a ban on confiscation.

pt_1.content: In addition to the tasks specified in Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the Data Protection Officer is responsible for at least the following tasks:

spt_1.content: Informing and advising the public sector body and employees carrying out processing operations of their obligations under this Act and other data protection legislation, including legislation implementing the Directive;

spt_2.content: Monitoring compliance with this Act and other data protection legislation, including legislation implementing the Directive, and the public sector body's policies for the protection of personal data, including the allocation of responsibilities, awareness-raising and training of employees involved in processing operations and related audits;

spt_3.content: Advice in connection with the data protection impact assessment and monitoring of its implementation in accordance with this law;

spt_5.content: Acting as a point of contact for the supervisory authority on issues related to processing, including prior consultation under this Act, and advising on any other issues as appropriate.

p_1.cpt_3.art_7.pt_1.spt_fc0bbb08-94fe-4.content: 2In the case of a data protection officer appointed by a court, these tasks do not relate to the court's actions in the context of its judicial activities.

pt_2.content: The data protection officer may perform other tasks and duties. The public body shall ensure that such tasks and duties do not lead to a conflict of interest.

p_1.cpt_3.art_7.pt_3.content: In performing his or her duties, the data protection officer shall take due account of the risk associated with the processing operations, taking into account the nature, scope, context and purposes of the processing.

16610ebd-1996-4f29-987d-ed457fd3a01b.content: The Federal Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information

pt_1.content: The Federal Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information (Federal Commissioner) is a supreme federal authority. The office is located in Bonn.

p_1.cpt_4.art_8.pt_2.content: The officials of the Federal Commissioner are federal civil servants.

pt_3.content: The Federal Commissioner may delegate personnel administration and personnel management tasks to other federal agencies, provided this does not impair the independence of the Federal Commissioner. Personal data of employees may be transmitted to these bodies insofar as knowledge thereof is necessary for the performance of the tasks assigned.

pt_1.content: The Federal Commissioner shall be responsible for the supervision of public bodies of the Federal Government, including those that participate in competition as public enterprises, and of enterprises insofar as they process data of natural or legal persons for the commercial provision of telecommunications services and the responsibility does not already arise from Section 29 of the Telecommunications Digital Services Data Protection Act. The provisions of this chapter shall also apply to processors insofar as they are non-public bodies in which the Federal Government holds the majority of shares or the majority of votes and the contracting authority is a public body of the Federal Government.

p_1.cpt_4.art_9.pt_2.content: The Federal Commissioner is not responsible for supervising the processing carried out by the federal courts in the course of their judicial activities.

pt_1.content: The Federal Commissioner shall act completely independently in the performance of his or her duties and in the exercise of his or her powers. He or she is not subject to direct or indirect external influence and neither seeks nor accepts instructions.

p_1.cpt_4.art_10.pt_2.content: The Federal Commissioner is subject to audit by the Federal Audit Office, provided this does not impair his or her independence.

pt_1.content: The German Bundestag elects the Federal Commissioner without debate on the proposal of the Federal Government by more than half of the statutory number of its members. The Federal Commissioner shall be appointed by the Federal President. The Federal Commissioner must have reached the age of 35 at the time of his or her election. He or she must have the necessary qualifications, experience and expertise to perform his or her duties and exercise his or her powers, particularly in the area of personal data protection. In particular, the Federal Commissioner must have knowledge of data protection law acquired through relevant professional experience and be qualified as a judge or senior civil servant.

pt_2.content: The Federal Commissioner takes the following oath before the Federal President: "I swear that I will devote my strength to the welfare of the German people, increase its benefit, avert harm from it, uphold and defend the Basic Law and the laws of the Federation, conscientiously fulfill my duties and do justice to everyone. So help me God." The oath can also be taken without religious affirmation.

pt_3.content: The term of office of the Federal Commissioner is five years. Re-election is permitted once.

p_1.cpt_4.art_12.pt_1.content: In accordance with this Act, the Federal Commissioner shall have an official relationship with the Federation under public law.

pt_2.content: The official relationship begins with the handing over of the certificate of appointment. It shall end upon expiry of the term of office or upon resignation. The Federal President shall remove the Federal Commissioner from office on the proposal of the President of the Bundestag if the Federal Commissioner has committed serious misconduct or no longer fulfills the requirements for the performance of his or her duties. In the event of termination of office or removal from office, the Federal Commissioner shall receive a certificate executed by the Federal President. Removal from office shall take effect upon delivery of the certificate. If the official relationship ends at the end of the term of office, the Federal Commissioner shall be obliged, at the request of the President of the Bundestag, to continue to conduct business for a maximum period of six months until a successor is appointed.

pt_3.content: The senior civil servant shall exercise the rights of the Federal Commissioner if the Federal Commissioner is prevented from exercising his or her office or if his or her official relationship ends and he or she is not obliged to continue his or her duties. Paragraph 1 shall apply accordingly.

pt_4.content: From the beginning of the calendar month in which the official relationship begins until the end of the calendar month in which the official relationship ends, in the case of paragraph 2 sentence 6 until the end of the month in which the management ends, the Federal Commissioner shall receive official remuneration in the amount of salary group B 11 as well as the family allowance in accordance with Annex V of the Federal Salaries Act. The Federal Travel Expenses Act and the Federal Relocation Expenses Act shall apply accordingly. In addition, Section 12 (6) and Sections bis and (5) of the Federal Ministers Act shall apply with the proviso that the four-year term of office in paragraph 1 of the Federal Ministers Act shall be replaced by a term of office of five years. By way of derogation from sentence 3 in conjunction with sections bis and paragraph 5 of the Federal Ministers Act, the pension of the Federal Commissioner shall be calculated by adding the term of office as a pensionable period of service in accordance with the Civil Servants Pension Act if this is more favorable and the Federal Commissioner was a civil servant or judge in at least the last office usually held before reaching grade B 11 immediately prior to his or her election as Federal Commissioner.

pt_1.content: The Federal Commissioner shall refrain from any action incompatible with the duties of his or her office and shall not, during his or her term of office, engage in any other paid or unpaid activity incompatible with his or her office. In particular, the Federal Commissioner may not hold any other remunerated office, trade or profession in addition to his or her office and may not be a member of the management or supervisory board or board of directors of a profit-oriented enterprise or a member of a government or a legislative body of the Federation or a Land. He or she may not provide extrajudicial expert opinions in return for payment.

pt_2.content: The Federal Commissioner shall notify the President of the Bundestag of any gifts he or she receives in connection with the office. The President of the Bundestag shall decide on the use of the gifts. He or she may issue procedural regulations.

pt_3.content: The Federal Commissioner shall be entitled to refuse to testify about persons who have entrusted facts to him or her in his or her capacity as Federal Commissioner, as well as about these facts themselves. This shall also apply to employees of the Federal Commissioner, subject to the proviso that the Federal Commissioner shall decide on the exercise of this right. Insofar as the Federal Commissioner's right to refuse to testify extends, he or she may not be required to produce or hand over files or other documents.

pt_4.content: The Federal Commissioner is obliged to maintain confidentiality about matters of which he or she becomes officially aware, even after termination of his or her official relationship. This shall not apply to communications in the course of official business or to facts which are obvious or whose significance does not require secrecy. The Federal Commissioner shall decide at his or her own discretion whether and to what extent he or she gives evidence or makes statements on such matters in court or out of court; if he or she is no longer in office, the approval of the Federal Commissioner in office shall be required. The statutory duty to report criminal offenses and to stand up for the preservation of the free democratic basic order in the event of a threat to it remains unaffected. Sections , and paragraph 1, paragraph 5 in conjunction with paragraph 1 and paragraph 1 of the Fiscal Code shall not apply to the Federal Commissioner and his or her staff. Sentence 5 shall not apply if the tax authorities require the information in order to conduct proceedings for a tax offense and related tax proceedings in the prosecution of which there is a compelling public interest, or if the information is deliberately false information provided by the person obliged to provide information or by persons acting on his or her behalf. If the Federal Commissioner discovers a data protection violation, he or she is authorized to report it and inform the person concerned.

pt_5.content: The Federal Commissioner may testify as a witness, unless the testimony would

p_1.cpt_4.art_13.pt_5.spt_1.content: are detrimental to the welfare of the Federal Republic or a Land, in particular to the security of the Federal Republic of Germany or its relations with other states, or

p_1.cpt_4.art_13.pt_5.spt_a51c111e-b9fa-.content: 2If the testimony concerns ongoing or completed procedures that are or could be attributable to the core area of executive responsibility of the Federal Government, the Federal Commissioner may only testify in consultation with the Federal Government. 3 Section 28 of the Federal Constitutional Court Act shall remain unaffected.

p_1.cpt_4.art_13.pt_6.content: Paragraphs 3 and 4 sentences 5 to 7 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the public bodies responsible for monitoring compliance with the provisions on data protection in the Länder.

pt_1.content: In addition to the tasks specified in Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the Federal Commissioner has the following tasks

spt_1.content: monitor and enforce the application of this Act and other provisions on data protection, including the legislation adopted to implement the Directive,

p_1.cpt_4.art_14.pt_1.spt_2.content: raise public awareness of and inform the public about the risks, rules, safeguards and rights relating to the processing of personal data, with particular attention to specific measures for children,

p_1.cpt_4.art_14.pt_1.spt_3.content: to advise the German Bundestag and the Bundesrat, the Federal Government and other institutions and bodies on legislative and administrative measures to protect the rights and freedoms of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data,

spt_4.content: raise awareness among controllers and processors of their obligations under this Act and other data protection legislation, including legislation implementing the Directive,

spt_5.content: to provide, upon request, any data subject with information on the exercise of his or her rights under this Act and other provisions on data protection, including legislation adopted pursuant to the Directive, and, where appropriate, to cooperate with the supervisory authorities in other Member States for this purpose,

spt_6.content: deal with complaints lodged by a data subject or by a body, organization or association in accordance with Article 55 of the Directive, investigate the subject matter of the complaint to an appropriate extent and inform the complainant of the progress and the outcome of the investigation within a reasonable period, in particular if further investigation or coordination with another supervisory authority is necessary,

spt_7.content: cooperate with other supervisory authorities, including by exchanging information, and provide them with administrative assistance to ensure the consistent application and enforcement of this Act and other provisions on data protection, including the legislation adopted to implement the Directive,

spt_8.content: conduct investigations into the application of this Act and other provisions on data protection, including the legislation adopted to implement the Directive, including on the basis of information provided by another supervisory authority or another authority,

p_1.cpt_4.art_14.pt_1.spt_9.content: monitor relevant developments insofar as they have an impact on the protection of personal data, in particular the development of information and communication technology and business practices,

spt_10.content: to provide advice in relation to the processing operations referred to in and

p_1.cpt_4.art_14.pt_1.spt_11.content: to contribute to the activities of the European Data Protection Board.

p_1.cpt_4.art_14.pt_1.spt_36c9bfa6-f594-.content: 2In the scope of application of Directive (EU) 2016/680, the Federal Commissioner shall also perform the task in accordance with Section 60.

pt_2.content: In order to fulfill the task referred to in paragraph 1 sentence 1 number 3, the Federal Commissioner may, on his or her own initiative or on request, address statements to the German Bundestag or one of its committees, the Bundesrat, the Federal Government, other institutions and bodies and the public on all issues relating to the protection of personal data. At the request of the German Bundestag, one of its committees or the Federal Government, the Federal Commissioner shall also investigate information on data protection matters and procedures at federal public bodies.

p_1.cpt_4.art_14.pt_3.content: The Federal Commissioner shall facilitate the submission of the complaints referred to in paragraph 1 sentence 1 number 6 through measures such as the provision of a complaint form that can also be completed electronically, without excluding other means of communication.

pt_4.content: The Federal Commissioner shall perform his or her duties free of charge for the data subject. In the case of manifestly unfounded or, in particular in the case of frequent repetition, excessive requests, the Federal Commissioner may demand a reasonable fee based on the administrative costs or refuse to act on the request. In this case, the Federal Commissioner shall bear the burden of proof for the manifestly unfounded or excessive nature of the request.

p_1.cpt_4.art_15.pt_1.content: 1The Federal Commissioner shall draw up an annual report on his or her activities, which may include a list of the types of infringements reported and the types of measures taken, including the sanctions imposed and the measures pursuant to Article 58(2) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. 2The Federal Commissioner shall forward the report to the German Bundestag, the Bundesrat and the Federal Government and shall make it available to the public, the European Commission and the European Data Protection Committee.

pt_1.content: Within the scope of application of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the Federal Commissioner shall exercise the powers pursuant to Regulation (EU) 2016/679. If the Federal Commissioner comes to the conclusion that there have been violations of data protection regulations or other deficiencies in the processing of personal data, he or she shall inform the competent legal or technical supervisory authority and give the controller the opportunity to comment within a reasonable period of time before exercising the powers under paragraph 2 letters b to g, i and j of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The opportunity to comment may be waived if an immediate decision appears necessary due to imminent danger or in the public interest or if it conflicts with an overriding public interest. The statement should also contain a description of the measures taken on the basis of the notification from the Federal Commissioner.

pt_2.content: If the Federal Commissioner discovers violations of the provisions of this Act or of other provisions on data protection or other deficiencies in the processing or use of personal data in data processing by federal public bodies for purposes outside the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, he or she shall lodge a complaint with the competent supreme federal authority and request a response from the latter within a period to be determined by him or her. The Federal Commissioner may refrain from making a complaint or from issuing a statement, in particular if the deficiencies are insignificant or have since been remedied. The statement shall also contain a description of the measures taken in response to the Commissioner's complaint. The Federal Commissioner may also warn the controller that intended processing operations are likely to violate the provisions of this Act and other data protection provisions applicable to the data processing in question.

pt_3.content: The powers of the Federal Commissioner also extend to

p_1.cpt_4.art_16.pt_3.spt_1.content: personal data obtained by its or his supervisory authorities on the content and circumstances of correspondence, post and telecommunications, and

spt_2.content: personal data that is subject to special official secrecy, in particular tax secrecy.

p_1.cpt_4.art_16.pt_3.spt_b6c1e49a-7308-.content: 2The fundamental right to secrecy of correspondence, post and telecommunications under Article 10 of the Basic Law is restricted in this respect.

pt_4.content: The public bodies of the Federation are obliged to provide the Federal Commissioner and his or her representatives with the following information

p_1.cpt_4.art_16.pt_4.spt_1.content: grant access at all times to the premises and offices, including all data processing systems and equipment, as well as to all personal data and information necessary for the performance of his or her duties, and

p_1.cpt_4.art_16.pt_4.spt_2.content: to provide all information necessary for the fulfillment of his or her tasks.

p_1.cpt_4.art_16.pt_4.spt_62ba3dcd-f2c2-.content: 2For non-public bodies, the obligation in sentence 1 number 1 only applies during normal operating and business hours.

pt_5.content: The Federal Commissioner shall work towards cooperation with the public bodies responsible for monitoring compliance with the provisions on data protection in the Länder and with the supervisory authorities. Paragraph 2, sentence 1, second half-sentence shall apply accordingly.

cc9752aa-241f-4dc6-b13e-2cc7526b714f.content:
Representation in the European Data Protection Committee, central point of contact, cooperation
    between the supervisory authorities of the federal government and states in European Union
    matters

0c841de6-a6a7-4392-865a-8257f3356676.content: Representation in the European Data Protection Board, central point of contact

pt_1.content: The joint representative in the European Data Protection Board and central point of contact is the Federal Commissioner (joint representative). The Federal Council elects a head of the supervisory authority of a federal state (deputy) as deputy to the joint representative. The election is for five years. Upon leaving office as head of the supervisory authority of a federal state, the function as deputy ends at the same time. Re-election is permitted.

p_1.cpt_5.art_17.pt_2.content: In matters relating to the performance of a task for which the Länder alone have the right to legislate or which relate to the establishment or procedure of Land authorities, the joint representative shall, at the request of the deputy, delegate the conduct of negotiations and the right to vote in the European Data Protection Board to the deputy.

326b1e1b-3c2d-42c7-8c8e-a84146520116.content: Procedure for cooperation between the federal and state supervisory authorities

pt_1.content: The Federal Commissioner and the supervisory authorities of the federal states (federal and state supervisory authorities) shall cooperate on European Union matters with the aim of ensuring uniform application of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the Directive. Before submitting a common position to the supervisory authorities of the other Member States, the European Commission or the European Data Protection Board, the federal and state supervisory authorities shall give each other the opportunity to comment at an early stage. To this end, they shall exchange all relevant information with each other. The federal and state supervisory authorities shall involve the specific supervisory authorities established in accordance with and Regulation (EU) 2016/679 if they are affected by the matter.

pt_2.content: If the supervisory authorities of the Federation and the Länder do not reach agreement on the common position, the lead authority or, in the absence thereof, the joint representative and his deputy shall submit a proposal for a common position. If the joint representative and his deputy do not agree on a proposal for a common position, the deputy shall determine the proposal for a common position in matters relating to the performance of tasks for which the Länder alone have the right to legislate or which relate to the establishment or procedure of Land authorities. In other cases where there is no agreement pursuant to sentence 2, the joint representative shall adopt the position. The position proposed in accordance with sentences 1 to 3 shall form the basis of the negotiations unless the supervisory authorities of the Federation and the Länder adopt a different position by simple majority. The Federal Government and each Land shall each have one vote. Abstentions shall not be counted.

pt_3.content: The joint representative and his/her deputy shall be bound by the common position in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2 and shall determine the respective conduct of negotiations by mutual agreement, taking this position into account. If an agreement cannot be reached, the deputy shall decide on the further conduct of negotiations in the matters referred to in paragraph 2 sentence 2. In all other cases, the joint representative shall have the casting vote.

pt_1.content: The lead supervisory authority of a country in the cooperation and consistency procedure under Chapter VII of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is the supervisory authority of the country in which the controller or processor has its main establishment within the meaning of point 16 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 or its only establishment in the European Union within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. In the area of responsibility of the Federal Commissioner, paragraph 1 in conjunction with point 16 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall apply accordingly. If there is no agreement on the lead authority, the procedure set out in paragraph 2 shall apply mutatis mutandis for determining the lead supervisory authority.

pt_2.content: The supervisory authority with which a data subject has lodged a complaint shall forward the complaint to the lead supervisory authority referred to in paragraph 1 or, in the absence thereof, to the supervisory authority of a country in which the controller or processor has an establishment. If a complaint is lodged with a supervisory authority which does not have subject-matter jurisdiction, it shall, if a transfer pursuant to sentence 1 is not possible, transfer the complaint to the supervisory authority at the complainant's place of residence. The receiving supervisory authority shall be deemed to be the supervisory authority pursuant to Chapter VII of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 with which the complaint has been lodged and shall comply with the obligations under paragraphs 7 to 9 and paragraph 6 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. In the area of responsibility of the Federal Commissioner, the supervisory authority with which a complaint has been lodged shall hand it over to the Federal Commissioner if a transfer pursuant to paragraph 1 is not possible.

pt_1.content: Disputes between a natural or legal person and a federal or state supervisory authority concerning rights pursuant to paragraphs 1 and 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall be subject to administrative law. Sentence 1 does not apply to fine proceedings.

p_1.cpt_6.art_20.pt_2.content: The Administrative Court Code shall apply in accordance with paragraphs 3 to 7.

p_1.cpt_6.art_20.pt_3.content: The administrative court in whose district the supervisory authority has its registered office shall have local jurisdiction for proceedings pursuant to paragraph 1 sentence 1.

p_1.cpt_6.art_20.pt_4.content: The supervisory authority may be involved in proceedings pursuant to paragraph 1 sentence 1.

pt_5.content: Parties to proceedings pursuant to paragraph 1 sentence 1 are

p_1.cpt_6.art_20.pt_5.spt_1.content: the natural or legal person as plaintiff or applicant and

p_1.cpt_6.art_20.pt_5.spt_2.content: the supervisory authority as the defendant or respondent.

p_1.cpt_6.art_20.pt_5.spt_7c5e7db7-f13a-.content: 2 Section 63 (3) and (4) of the Administrative Court Code remains unaffected.

pt_7.content: The supervisory authority may not order immediate enforcement against an authority or its legal entity pursuant to paragraph 2 sentence 1 number 4 of the Administrative Court Code.

b916a3b8-f101-4f98-9388-173d693742be.content: Application by the supervisory authority for a court decision in the event of assumed illegality of a decision by the European Commission

p_1.cpt_6.art_21.pt_1.content: If a supervisory authority considers an adequacy decision of the European Commission, a decision on the recognition of standard protection clauses or on the general validity of approved codes of conduct, the validity of which is decisive for a decision by the supervisory authority, to be unlawful, the supervisory authority must suspend its proceedings and apply for a court decision.

pt_2.content: Proceedings under paragraph 1 shall be subject to administrative law. The Administrative Court Code shall apply in accordance with paragraphs 3 to 6.

p_1.cpt_6.art_21.pt_3.content: The Federal Administrative Court shall decide on an application by the supervisory authority in accordance with paragraph 1 in the first and final instance.

pt_4.content: The supervisory authority may participate in proceedings pursuant to paragraph 1. The supervisory authority shall be involved as an applicant in proceedings pursuant to paragraph 1; numbers 3 and 4 of the Code of Administrative Court Procedure shall remain unaffected. The Federal Administrative Court may give the European Commission the opportunity to comment within a period to be determined.

p_1.cpt_6.art_21.pt_5.content: If proceedings to review the validity of a decision of the European Commission pursuant to paragraph 1 are pending before the Court of Justice of the European Union, the Federal Administrative Court may order that the hearing be suspended until the proceedings before the Court of Justice of the European Union have been concluded.

pt_6.content: In proceedings pursuant to paragraph 1, paragraph 5 sentence 1 and paragraph 6 of the Administrative Court Code shall apply mutatis mutandis. If the Federal Administrative Court comes to the conclusion that the decision of the European Commission pursuant to paragraph 1 is valid, it shall state this in its decision. Otherwise, it shall refer the question of the validity of the decision to the Court of Justice of the European Union for a ruling in accordance with Article 267 of the

p_2.content:
Part 2 – Implementing provisions for purposes for purposes in accordance with Article 2 of
  Regulation (EU) 2016/679

e1f33bd1-e5e3-4704-ba5b-33da24200b6a.content: Legal basis for the processing of personal data

9750affd-5d90-49b9-9d95-8d0fa50ac8f4.content: Processing of special categories of personal data and processing for other purposes

7801515b-96da-469a-936a-c04978338524.content: Processing of special categories of personal data

pt_1.content: By way of derogation from paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the processing of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is permitted

spt_1.content: by public and non-public bodies, if they

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_a.content: is necessary to exercise the rights and fulfill the obligations arising from social security and social protection law,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_b.content: is necessary for the purpose of preventive health care, for the assessment of the employee's fitness for work, for medical diagnosis, health or social care or treatment, or for the management of health and social care systems and services, or on the basis of a contract between the data subject and a health professional, and these data are processed by or under the responsibility of medical staff or other persons subject to an appropriate duty of confidentiality,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_c.content: is necessary for reasons of public interest in the field of public health, such as protection against serious cross-border threats to health or to ensure high standards of quality and safety in healthcare and in medicinal products and medical devices; in addition to the measures referred to in paragraph 2, the professional and criminal law requirements for maintaining professional secrecy in particular must be complied with, or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_d.content: is absolutely necessary for reasons of substantial public interest,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_a.content: is necessary to avert a serious threat to public safety,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_b.content: is absolutely necessary to prevent significant disadvantages for the common good or to safeguard significant interests of the common good or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_c.content: is required for compelling reasons of defense or the fulfillment of supranational or intergovernmental obligations of a federal public body in the field of crisis management or conflict prevention or for humanitarian measures

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_d.content: and insofar as the interests of the controller in data processing outweigh the interests of the data subject in the cases referred to in points 1(d) and 2.

pt_2.content: In the cases referred to in paragraph 1, appropriate and specific measures shall be taken to safeguard the interests of the data subject. Taking into account the state of the art, the cost of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons posed by the processing, these measures may include, in particular

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_1.content: technical and organizational measures to ensure that processing is carried out in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_2.content: Measures that ensure that it is possible to subsequently check and determine whether and by whom personal data has been entered, changed or removed,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_3.content: Sensitization of those involved in processing operations,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_4.content: Appointment of a data protection officer,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_5.content: Restriction of access to personal data within the controller and processors,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_8.content: Ensuring the capability, confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of systems and services related to the processing of personal data, including the ability to rapidly restore availability and access in the event of a physical or technical incident,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_9.content: to ensure the security of the processing, the establishment of a procedure for the regular review, assessment and evaluation of the effectiveness of the technical and organizational measures, or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_22.pt_2.spt_10.content: specific procedural arrangements to ensure compliance with the requirements of this Act and Regulation (EU) 2016/679 in the event of transfer or processing for other purposes.

224c27d4-0400-4ccc-9ba9-2389de906ebc.content: Processing for other purposes by public authorities

pt_1.content: The processing of personal data for a purpose other than that for which the data was collected by public bodies in the course of their duties is permitted if

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_23.pt_1.spt_1.content: it is obvious that it is in the interest of the data subject and there is no reason to assume that he or she would refuse consent if he or she were aware of the other purpose,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_23.pt_1.spt_2.content: information provided by the data subject must be verified because there are factual indications that it is incorrect,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_23.pt_1.spt_3.content: it is necessary to prevent significant disadvantages for the common good or a threat to public safety, defense or national security, to safeguard significant public welfare interests or to secure tax and customs revenue,

spt_4.content: it is necessary for the prosecution of criminal offenses or administrative offenses, for the execution or enforcement of penalties or measures within the meaning of paragraph 1 number 8 of the Criminal Code or of educational measures or correctional measures within the meaning of the Juvenile Courts Act or for the enforcement of fines,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_23.pt_1.spt_5.content: it is necessary to prevent a serious impairment of the rights of another person or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_23.pt_1.spt_6.content: it serves the exercise of supervisory and control powers, auditing or the performance of organizational investigations of the controller; this also applies to processing for training and auditing purposes by the controller, provided that this does not conflict with the interests of the data subject worthy of protection.

pt_2.content: The processing of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 for a purpose other than that for which the data was collected is permitted if the conditions of paragraph 1 and an exception pursuant to paragraph 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 or after are met.

70d8a1af-478f-44f0-ba5c-e77723acdc4b.content: Processing for other purposes by non-public bodies

pt_1.content: The processing of personal data for a purpose other than that for which the data was collected by non-public bodies is permitted if

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_24.pt_1.spt_1.content: it is necessary for the prevention of threats to state or public security or for the prosecution of criminal offenses or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_24.pt_1.spt_2.content: it is necessary for the assertion, exercise or defense of civil law claims,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_24.pt_1.spt_51905553.content: unless the interests of the data subject in the exclusion of processing prevail.

pt_2.content: The processing of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 for a purpose other than that for which the data was collected is permitted if the conditions of paragraph 1 and an exception pursuant to paragraph 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 or after are met.

pt_1.content: The transfer of personal data by public bodies to public bodies is permitted if it is necessary for the performance of the tasks for which the transferring body or the third party to whom the data is transferred is responsible and the conditions are met that would permit processing in accordance with. The third party to whom the data is transferred may only process it for the purpose for which it was transferred. Processing for other purposes is permitted under the conditions set out in Art.

pt_2.content: The transfer of personal data by public bodies to non-public bodies is permitted if

spt_1.content: it is necessary for the performance of the tasks for which the transmitting body is responsible and the conditions are met which would permit processing in accordance with,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_25.pt_2.spt_2.content: the third party to whom the data is transferred credibly demonstrates a legitimate interest in knowing the data to be transferred and the data subject has no legitimate interest in the exclusion of the transfer, or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_25.pt_2.spt_3.content: it is necessary for the assertion, exercise or defense of legal claims

p_2.cpt_1.sct_1.art_25.pt_2.spt_95633b74.content: and the third party has given an undertaking to the transmitting public authority to process the data only for the purpose for which they were transmitted to it. 2 Processing for other purposes shall be permitted if transmission pursuant to sentence 1 would be permissible and the transmitting body has given its consent.

pt_3.content: The transfer of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is permitted if the requirements of paragraph 1 or 2 and an exception pursuant to paragraph 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 or pursuant to are met.

5db4e16f-0e04-48dc-9b77-94f765d38356.content: Data processing for the purposes of the employment relationship

pt_1.content: Personal data of employees may be processed for the purposes of the employment relationship if this is necessary for the decision on the establishment of an employment relationship or, after the establishment of the employment relationship, for its implementation or termination or for the exercise or fulfillment of the rights and obligations of the representation of the interests of the employees arising from a law or a collective agreement, a works or service agreement (collective agreement). Personal data of employees may only be processed for the detection of criminal offenses if there are factual indications to be documented that justify the suspicion that the person concerned has committed a criminal offense in the employment relationship, the processing is necessary for detection and the employee's legitimate interest in the exclusion of processing does not prevail, in particular the type and extent are not disproportionate with regard to the reason.

pt_2.content: If the processing of personal data of employees is based on consent, the assessment of the voluntariness of the consent must take into account in particular the dependency of the employee in the employment relationship and the circumstances under which the consent was given. Consent may be voluntary in particular if a legal or economic advantage is achieved for the employee or if the employer and the employee pursue similar interests. Consent must be given in writing or electronically, unless another form is appropriate due to special circumstances. The employer must inform the employee in text form about the purpose of the data processing and about their right to withdraw consent in accordance with paragraph 3 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

pt_3.content: By way of derogation from paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the processing of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is permitted for the purposes of the employment relationship if it is necessary for the exercise of rights or the fulfillment of legal obligations under labor law, social security law and social protection law and there is no reason to assume that the data subject's legitimate interest in the exclusion of processing prevails. Paragraph 2 also applies to consent to the processing of special categories of personal data; the consent must explicitly refer to these data. Paragraph 2 shall apply accordingly.

pt_4.content: The processing of personal data, including special categories of personal data of employees for the purposes of the employment relationship, is permitted on the basis of collective agreements. The negotiating partners must observe paragraph 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

pt_5.content: The controller must take appropriate measures to ensure that the principles for the processing of personal data set out in Regulation (EU) 2016/679 in particular are complied with.

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_6.content: The participation rights of the employee representatives remain unaffected.

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_7.content: Paragraphs 1 to 6 shall also apply if personal data, including special categories of personal data, are processed by employees without being stored or intended to be stored in a filing system.

pt_8.content: Employees within the meaning of this Act are

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_1.content: Employees, including temporary workers in relation to the hirer,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_3.content: Participants in benefits for participation in working life and in assessments of professional aptitude or work trials (rehabilitants),

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_4.content: people employed in recognized workshops for disabled people,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_5.content: Volunteers who perform a service in accordance with the Youth Volunteer Service Act or the Federal Volunteer Service Act,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_6.content: Persons who are to be regarded as employee-like persons due to their economic independence; these also include those working from home and those treated as such,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_7.content: Federal civil servants, federal judges, soldiers and persons performing civilian service.

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_26.pt_8.spt_2c4c4ee6.content: 2Applicants for an employment relationship and persons whose employment relationship has ended are deemed to be employees.

2014b237-affd-4de3-b2da-2ddb2a27501c.content: Data processing for scientific or historical research purposes and for statistical purposes

pt_1.content: By way of derogation from paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the processing of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is also permitted without consent for scientific or historical research purposes or for statistical purposes if the processing is necessary for these purposes and the interests of the controller in the processing significantly outweigh the interests of the data subject in the exclusion of the processing. The controller shall implement suitable and specific measures to safeguard the data subject's interests in accordance with the second sentence of paragraph 2.

pt_2.content: The rights of the data subject provided for in , , and Regulation (EU) 2016/679 are restricted to the extent that these rights are likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the research or statistical purposes and the restriction is necessary for the fulfillment of the research or statistical purposes. Furthermore, the right to information in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 does not exist if the data is necessary for the purposes of scientific research and the provision of information would require a disproportionate effort.

pt_3.content: In addition to the measures referred to in paragraph 2, special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 processed for scientific or historical research purposes or for statistical purposes shall be anonymized as soon as this is possible for the research or statistical purposes, unless this conflicts with the legitimate interests of the data subject. Until then, the characteristics with which individual data on personal or factual circumstances can be assigned to an identified or identifiable person must be stored separately. They may only be merged with the individual data if this is necessary for research or statistical purposes.

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_27.pt_4.content: The controller may only publish personal data if the data subject has consented or if this is essential for the presentation of research findings on contemporary events.

38a1922b-fe4f-4bb3-97ff-492aa375d342.content: Data processing for archiving purposes in the public interest

pt_1.content: By way of derogation from paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the processing of special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 is permitted if it is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest. The controller shall implement suitable and specific measures to safeguard the data subject's interests in accordance with the second sentence of paragraph 2.

pt_2.content: The right of access of the data subject pursuant to Regulation (EU) 2016/679 does not apply if the archive records are not indexed by the name of the person or if no information is provided that would enable the archive records concerned to be located with reasonable administrative effort.

pt_3.content: The data subject does not have the right to rectification in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 if the personal data are processed for archiving purposes in the public interest. If the data subject disputes the accuracy of the personal data, they must be given the opportunity to submit a counterstatement. The responsible archive is obliged to add the counterstatement to the documents.

pt_4.content: The rights provided for in paragraph 1(a), (b) and (d) and Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall not apply to the extent that these rights are likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of archiving purposes in the public interest and the exceptions are necessary for the fulfillment of those purposes.

7c10e622-a156-42cc-93e1-3ade3541b193.content: Rights of the data subject and supervisory authority powers in the event of confidentiality obligations

pt_1.content: The obligation to inform the data subject pursuant to paragraphs 1 to 4 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall not apply, in addition to the exceptions referred to in paragraph 5 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, insofar as its fulfillment would reveal information which by its nature must be kept secret, in particular because of the overriding legitimate interests of a third party. The data subject's right of access in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 does not apply if the access would reveal information that must be kept secret in accordance with a legal provision or by its nature, in particular because of the overriding legitimate interests of a third party. In addition to the exception referred to in paragraph 3 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the obligation to notify in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 does not apply if the notification would disclose information that must be kept secret in accordance with a legal provision or by its nature, in particular because of the overriding legitimate interests of a third party. By way of derogation from the exception in sentence 3, the data subject must be notified in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 if the interests of the data subject outweigh the interest in confidentiality, in particular taking into account the threat of harm.

pt_2.content: If third-party data is transmitted to a person subject to professional secrecy in the course of admission or within the framework of a client relationship, the transmitting body is not obliged to inform the data subject in accordance with paragraph 3 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, unless the data subject's interest in providing information prevails.

pt_3.content: The investigative powers of the supervisory authorities pursuant to paragraph 1 (e) and (f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall not apply to the persons referred to in paragraphs 1, 2a and 3 of the German Criminal Code or their processors if the use of these powers would lead to a breach of the confidentiality obligations of these persons. If, in the course of an investigation, a supervisory authority obtains knowledge of data subject to a duty of confidentiality within the meaning of sentence 1, the duty of confidentiality shall also apply to the supervisory authority.

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_30.pt_1.content: An entity that collects, stores or modifies personal data that may be used to assess the creditworthiness of consumers for the purpose of transmission must treat requests for information from lenders from other Member States of the European Union in the same way as requests for information from domestic lenders.

pt_2.content: Any person who refuses to conclude a consumer loan agreement or a contract for financial assistance against payment with a consumer as a result of information provided by a body within the meaning of paragraph 1 shall inform the consumer of this and of the information received without delay. The information shall not be provided if this would jeopardize public safety or order. remains unaffected.

3dd52bd7-2e95-46bf-866e-37185a9bb231.content: Protection of commercial transactions with scoring and credit reports

pt_1.content: The use of a probability value about a certain future behavior of a natural person for the purpose of deciding on the establishment, execution or termination of a contractual relationship with this person (scoring) is only permitted if

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_1.spt_1.content: the provisions of data protection law have been complied with,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_1.spt_2.content: the data used to calculate the probability value are demonstrably significant for the calculation of the probability of the specific behavior on the basis of a scientifically recognized mathematical-statistical method,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_1.spt_3.content: address data were not exclusively used for the calculation of the probability value and

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_1.spt_4.content: in the case of the use of address data, the data subject has been informed of the intended use of this data before the probability value is calculated; this information must be documented.

pt_2.content: The use of a probability value determined by credit agencies regarding the ability and willingness of a natural person to pay is only permitted in the case of the inclusion of information on claims if the conditions set out in paragraph 1 are met and only such claims for a service owed that has not been provided despite being due are taken into account,

spt_1.content: which have been established by a final judgment or a judgment declared provisionally enforceable or for which a debt instrument exists,

spt_2.content: which have been established and not disputed by the debtor at the verification meeting,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_3.content: which the debtor has expressly acknowledged,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_4.sspt_a.content: the debtor has received at least two written reminders after the claim became due,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_4.sspt_b.content: the first reminder was sent at least four weeks ago,

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_4.sspt_c.content: the debtor has been informed in advance, but not before the first reminder, of a possible consideration by a credit agency and

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_4.sspt_d.content: the debtor has not disputed the claim or

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_5.content: whose underlying contractual relationship can be terminated without notice due to payment arrears and where the debtor has previously been informed of possible consideration by a credit agency.

p_2.cpt_1.sct_2.art_31.pt_2.spt_fc701778.content: 2The permissibility of the processing, including the determination of probability values, of other data relevant to creditworthiness under general data protection law remains unaffected.

dfbb3992-5305-4f9d-8b3b-33154056bb08.content: Duty to provide information when collecting personal data from the data subject

pt_1.content: The obligation to inform the data subject in accordance with paragraph 3 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, in addition to the exception referred to in paragraph 4 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, does not apply if the provision of information about the intended further processing

p_2.cpt_2.art_32.pt_1.spt_1.content: concerns further processing of data stored in analog form, where the controller directly addresses the data subject through the further processing, the purpose is compatible with the original purpose of collection in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the communication with the data subject is not in digital form and the interest of the data subject in receiving the information is considered to be low in the circumstances of the individual case, in particular in view of the context in which the data was collected.

spt_2.content: in the case of a public body, would jeopardize the proper performance of the tasks covered by the controller's competence within the meaning of paragraph 1(a) to (e) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the interests of the controller in not providing the information outweigh the interests of the data subject,

p_2.cpt_2.art_32.pt_1.spt_3.content: would jeopardize public security or order or otherwise be detrimental to the welfare of the Federal Government or a Land and the interests of the controller in not providing the information outweigh the interests of the data subject,

p_2.cpt_2.art_32.pt_1.spt_4.content: would impair the assertion, exercise or defense of legal claims and the interests of the controller in not providing the information outweigh the interests of the data subject, or

p_2.cpt_2.art_32.pt_1.spt_5.content: would jeopardize the confidential transmission of data to public authorities.

pt_2.content: Where information is not provided to the data subject in accordance with paragraph 1, the controller shall take appropriate measures to protect the legitimate interests of the data subject, including making the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 available to the public in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language. The controller shall record in writing the reasons for not providing the information. Sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply in the cases of paragraph 1 numbers 4 and 5.

p_2.cpt_2.art_32.pt_3.content: If the notification is omitted in the cases of paragraph 1 due to a temporary impediment, the controller shall comply with the information obligation, taking into account the specific circumstances of the processing, within a reasonable period after the impediment has ceased to exist, but at the latest within two weeks.

09716136-1a3c-4b3f-a044-1b6833a1c01e.content: Obligation to provide information if the personal data was not collected from the data subject

pt_1.content: The obligation to inform the data subject in accordance with paragraphs 1, 2 and 4 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 does not apply in addition to the exceptions set out in paragraph 5 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the first sentence of paragraph 1 if the provision of information

spt_1.content: in the case of a public body

p_2.cpt_2.art_33.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_a.content: would jeopardize the proper performance of the tasks under the responsibility of the controller within the meaning of paragraph 1(a) to (e) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, or

p_2.cpt_2.art_33.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_b.content: would jeopardize public safety or order or otherwise be detrimental to the welfare of the federal government or a state

p_2.cpt_2.art_33.pt_1.spt_1.sspt_c.content: and therefore the interest of the data subject in the provision of information must take a back seat,

spt_2.content: in the case of a non-public body

p_2.cpt_2.art_33.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_a.content: would prejudice the establishment, exercise or defense of civil claims or the processing involves data from civil law contracts and serves the prevention of damage caused by criminal offences, unless the legitimate interest of the data subject in the provision of information prevails, or

p_2.cpt_2.art_33.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_b.content: the competent public authority has determined vis-à-vis the controller that the disclosure of the data would jeopardize public security or order or otherwise be detrimental to the welfare of the Federation or a Land; in the case of data processing for the purposes of criminal prosecution, no determination pursuant to the first half-sentence is required

pt_2.content: Where information is not provided to the data subject in accordance with paragraph 1, the controller shall take appropriate measures to protect the legitimate interests of the data subject, including making the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 available to the public in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language. The controller shall record in writing the reasons for not providing the information.

p_2.cpt_2.art_33.pt_3.content: If the provision of information relates to the transmission of personal data by public bodies to the constitution protection authorities, the Federal Intelligence Service, the Military Counter-Intelligence Service and, insofar as federal security is affected, other authorities of the Federal Ministry of Defense, it is only permissible with the consent of these bodies.

d12103e2-93ed-472d-8f4b-20b6671d4e91.content: Right to information of the data subject

pt_1.content: In addition to the exceptions mentioned in paragraph 2, paragraph 2 and paragraph 1 sentence 2, the data subject's right of access in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 does not apply if

spt_1.content: the data subject is not to be informed in accordance with paragraph 1(1), (2)(b) or (3), or

p_2.cpt_2.art_34.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_a.content: are only stored because they may not be deleted due to legal or statutory retention requirements, or

p_2.cpt_2.art_34.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_b.content: serve exclusively the purposes of data backup or data protection control

p_2.cpt_2.art_34.pt_1.spt_2.sspt_c.content: and the provision of information would require a disproportionate effort and processing for other purposes is excluded by appropriate technical and organizational measures.

pt_2.content: The reasons for the refusal to provide information must be documented. The refusal to provide information shall be justified to the data subject, unless the purpose of the refusal to provide information would be jeopardized by the communication of the factual and legal reasons on which the decision is based. The data stored for the purpose of providing information to the data subject and for its preparation may only be processed for this purpose and for data protection control purposes; for other purposes, processing must be restricted in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679.

pt_3.content: If the data subject is not provided with information by a public body of the Federal Government, it shall be provided to the Federal Commissioner upon request, unless the competent supreme federal authority determines in individual cases that this would jeopardize the security of the Federal Government or a Land. The Federal Commissioner's notification to the data subject about the result of the data protection review must not allow any conclusions to be drawn about the controller's level of knowledge, unless the controller agrees to provide further information.

p_2.cpt_2.art_34.pt_4.content: The data subject's right of access to personal data that is neither automatically processed nor not automatically processed by a public authority and stored in a file system only exists if the data subject provides information that enables the data to be found and the effort required to provide the information is not disproportionate to the interest in information asserted by the data subject.

pt_1.content: If, in the case of non-automated data processing, erasure is not possible or only possible with disproportionate effort due to the special nature of the storage and the data subject's interest in erasure is considered to be low, the data subject's right and the controller's obligation to erase personal data pursuant to paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall not apply in addition to the exceptions set out in paragraph 3 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. In this case, the restriction of processing pursuant to Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall take the place of erasure. Sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply if the personal data have been processed unlawfully.

pt_2.content: In addition to paragraph 1(b) and (c) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the first and second sentences of paragraph 1 shall apply mutatis mutandis in the case of paragraph 1(a) and (d) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, as long as and insofar as the controller has reason to believe that erasure would adversely affect the data subject's legitimate interests. The controller shall inform the data subject of the restriction of processing, unless this proves impossible or would involve a disproportionate effort.

pt_3.content: In addition to paragraph 3(b) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, paragraph 1 shall apply accordingly in the case of paragraph 1(a) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 if statutory or contractual retention periods prevent deletion.

p_2.cpt_2.art_36.pt_1.content: The right to object pursuant to Article 21(1) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 vis-à-vis a public authority does not exist if there is an overriding public interest in the processing that outweighs the interests of the data subject or if a legal provision requires the processing.

a34268d0-df5c-47c1-bdbc-0d15892ce85b.content: Automated decisions in individual cases including profiling

pt_1.content: The right under paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing does not exist, apart from the exceptions referred to in paragraph 2(a) and (c) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, if the decision is taken in the context of the provision of services under an insurance contract and

p_2.cpt_2.art_37.pt_1.spt_1.content: the request of the data subject has been granted or

p_2.cpt_2.art_37.pt_1.spt_2.content: the decision is based on the application of binding medical fee regulations and the controller takes reasonable measures to safeguard the legitimate interests of the data subject in the event that the request is not granted in full, including at least the right to obtain the intervention of a person on the part of the controller, to express his or her point of view and to contest the decision; the controller shall inform the data subject of these rights at the latest at the time of the communication indicating that the data subject's request is not granted in full.

pt_2.content: Decisions pursuant to paragraph 1 may be based on the processing of health data within the meaning of point 15 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679. The controller shall implement suitable and specific measures to safeguard the data subject's interests in accordance with the second sentence of paragraph 2.

1b7933d7-0a6e-4903-af2d-04e75ef13eea.content: Obligations of those responsible and processors

94fee087-93d7-4528-a41f-96797d382d8f.content: Data protection officers of non-public bodies

pt_1.content: In addition to paragraph 1(b) and (c) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the controller and the processor shall designate a data protection officer if they generally employ at least 20 persons permanently for the automated processing of personal data. If the controller or processor carries out processing operations that are subject to a data protection impact assessment in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679, or if they process personal data on a commercial basis for the purpose of transmission, anonymized transmission or for the purpose of market or opinion research, they must appoint a data protection officer, regardless of the number of persons involved in the processing.

pt_2.content: Paragraphs 4, 5 sentence 2 and 6 shall apply, but paragraph 4 shall only apply if the appointment of a data protection officer is mandatory.

p_2.cpt_3.art_39.pt_1.content: 1The authorization to act as a certification body pursuant to Article 43 (1) sentence 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall be granted by the federal or state supervisory authority responsible for the supervision of the certification body under data protection law on the basis of accreditation by the German Accreditation Body. 2 Section 2 (3) sentence 2, Section 4 (3) and Section 10 (1) sentence 1 number 3 of the Accreditation Bodies Act shall apply with the proviso that data protection is deemed to be an area falling within the scope of Section 1 (2) sentence 2.

d2b5e363-6195-4c3a-a639-9ebcff32f537.content: Data processing supervisory authority through non-public bodies

686118aa-f509-4f7d-9cbd-403caf182ba4.content: Supervisory authorities of the federal states

p_2.cpt_4.art_40.pt_1.content: Within the scope of application of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the authorities responsible under national law monitor the application of data protection regulations by non-public bodies.

pt_2.content: If the controller or processor has several domestic establishments, point 16 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall apply mutatis mutandis to determine the competent supervisory authority. If several authorities consider themselves to be competent or not competent or if the competence is in doubt for other reasons, the supervisory authorities shall make the decision jointly in accordance with paragraph 2. shall apply accordingly.

pt_3.content: The supervisory authority may only process the data stored by it for supervisory purposes; in doing so, it may transmit data to other supervisory authorities. Processing for another purpose is permitted beyond paragraph 4 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 if
