p_2.cpt_4.art_40.pt_3.spt_1.content: it is obvious that it is in the interest of the data subject and there is no reason to assume that he or she would refuse consent if he or she were aware of the other purpose,

p_2.cpt_4.art_40.pt_3.spt_2.content: it is necessary to prevent significant disadvantages for the common good or a threat to public safety or to safeguard significant interests of the common good, or

spt_3.content: it is necessary for the prosecution of criminal offenses or administrative offenses, for the execution or enforcement of penalties or measures within the meaning of the Juvenile Courts Act or of educational measures or correctional measures within the meaning of the Juvenile Courts Act or for the enforcement of fines.

p_2.cpt_4.art_40.pt_3.spt_ea0bc67e-13a1-.content: 3If the supervisory authority discovers a breach of the provisions on data protection, it shall be authorized to inform the persons concerned thereof, to report the breach to other bodies responsible for prosecution or punishment and, in the case of serious breaches, to inform the trade supervisory authority for the implementation of measures under trade law. 4 Section 13 (4) sentences 4 to 7 shall apply accordingly.

pt_4.content: The bodies subject to supervision and the persons entrusted with their management must provide a supervisory authority with the information required for the fulfillment of its duties upon request. The party obliged to provide information may refuse to answer questions which, if answered, would expose it or one of its designated relatives to the risk of criminal prosecution or proceedings under the Administrative Offenses Act. The person obliged to provide information must be informed of this.

pt_5.content: The persons appointed by a supervisory authority to monitor compliance with data protection regulations are authorized to enter the premises and business premises of the body and to gain access to all data processing systems and devices in order to perform their tasks. The body is obliged to tolerate this. Paragraph 4 shall apply accordingly.

pt_6.content: The supervisory authorities shall advise and support the data protection officers, taking into account their typical needs. They may demand the dismissal of the data protection officer if he or she does not have the necessary expertise to perform his or her duties or, in the case of paragraph 6 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, if there is a serious conflict of interest.

p_2.cpt_4.art_40.pt_7.content: The application of the Trade Regulations remains unaffected.

837b9e79-231e-4dde-8827-d9a883ff9910.content: Application of the provisions on fines and criminal proceedings

9218f493-b83b-4a9f-8ffc-4693a731c966.content: Legal action against the controller or processor

pt_1.content: Actions brought by the data subject against a controller or processor for a breach of data protection provisions within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 or the rights of the data subject contained therein may be brought before the court of the place where an establishment of the controller or processor is located. Actions pursuant to sentence 1 may also be brought before the court of the place where the data subject has their habitual residence.

p_2.cpt_6.art_44.pt_2.content: Paragraph 1 shall not apply to actions against authorities that have acted in the exercise of their sovereign powers.

92ec1be7-bf30-426c-af36-ffd5f8882761.content: Scope, definitions and general principles for the processing of personal data

p_3.cpt_1.art_45.pt_1.content: 1The provisions of this Part shall apply to the processing of personal data by public bodies responsible for the prevention, investigation, detection, prosecution or punishment of criminal offences or administrative offences, insofar as they process data for the purpose of fulfilling these tasks. 2The public authorities shall be deemed to be data controllers. 3The prevention of criminal offenses within the meaning of sentence 1 includes the protection against and the prevention of threats to public security. 4Sentences 1 and 2 shall also apply to those public bodies that are responsible for the enforcement of penalties, measures within the meaning of section 11(1) no. 8 of the Criminal Code, educational measures or correctional measures within the meaning of the Juvenile Courts Act and fines. 5 Insofar as this Part contains provisions for processors, it shall also apply to them.

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_1.content: "personal data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (data subject); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that person;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_2.content: "Processing" means any operation or set of operations which is performed on personal data or on sets of personal data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation, alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_3.content: "Restriction of processing" means the marking of stored personal data with the aim of restricting its future processing;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_4.content: "Profiling" means any form of automated processing of personal data consisting of the use of personal data to evaluate certain personal aspects relating to a natural person, in particular to analyze or predict aspects concerning that natural person's performance at work, economic situation, health, personal preferences, interests, reliability, behavior, location or movements;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_5.content: "Pseudonymization" means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organizational measures to ensure that the data cannot be attributed to a specific data subject;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_6.content: "file system" means any structured collection of personal data that is accessible according to specific criteria, regardless of whether this collection is managed centrally, decentrally or according to functional or geographical aspects;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_7.content: "Controller" means the natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_8.content: "Processor" means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_9.content: "recipient" means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or another body, to which the personal data are disclosed, whether a third party or not; however, public authorities which may receive personal data in the framework of a particular inquiry in accordance with Union or Member State law shall not be regarded as recipients; the processing of those data by those public authorities shall be in compliance with the applicable data protection rules according to the purposes of the processing;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_10.content: "Personal data breach" means a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure of, or access to, personal data undergoing processing;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_11.content: 'genetic data' means personal data relating to the inherited or acquired genetic characteristics of a natural person, which provide unique information about the physiology or health of that person, in particular those obtained from the analysis of a biological sample from the person;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_12.content: 'biometric data' means personal data relating to the physical, physiological or behavioral characteristics of a natural person, obtained using specific technical procedures, which allow or confirm the unique identification of that natural person, in particular facial images or dactyloscopic data;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_13.content: "health data" means personal data relating to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of healthcare services, and from which information about their health status is derived;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_14.spt_1.content: Data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs or trade union membership,

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_14.spt_3.content: biometric data for the unique identification of a natural person,

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_14.spt_5.content: Data on sexual life or sexual orientation;

pt_15.content: 'supervisory authority' means an independent public authority established by a Member State in accordance with Article 41 of the Directive;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_16.content: "international organization" means an international organization and its subordinate bodies and any other body created by, or on the basis of, an agreement concluded by two or more States;

p_3.cpt_1.art_46.pt_17.content: "Consent" means any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which he or she, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signifies agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her.

55795ef5-896c-441c-baf8-55ae706d13a0.content: General principles for the processing of personal data

p_3.cpt_1.art_47.pt_1.content: processed in a lawful manner and in good faith,

p_3.cpt_1.art_47.pt_2.content: collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not processed in a manner incompatible with those purposes,

p_3.cpt_1.art_47.pt_3.content: be adequate, necessary for achieving the purpose of the processing and their processing is not disproportionate to that purpose,

p_3.cpt_1.art_47.pt_4.content: accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date; every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay,

p_3.cpt_1.art_47.pt_5.content: stored in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed; and

p_3.cpt_1.art_47.pt_6.content: processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing, accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical and organizational measures.

a37e1513-24e7-4a9e-8012-c405317aef7b.content: Legal basis for the processing of personal data

ced6a4d2-0271-4ee7-8065-2e4b0c378d2b.content: Processing of special categories of personal data

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_1.content: The processing of special categories of personal data is only permitted if it is absolutely necessary for the fulfillment of the task.

pt_2.content: Where special categories of personal data are processed, appropriate safeguards must be provided for the legal interests of the data subjects. Appropriate safeguards may in particular be

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_2.spt_1.content: specific requirements for data security or data protection control,

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_2.spt_2.content: the definition of special segregation review periods,

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_2.spt_3.content: raising the awareness of those involved in processing operations,

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_2.spt_4.content: the restriction of access to personal data within the controller,

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_2.spt_7.content: the encryption of personal data or

p_3.cpt_2.art_48.pt_2.spt_8.content: specific procedural rules ensuring the lawfulness of processing in the event of transfer or processing for other purposes.

p_3.cpt_2.art_49.pt_1.content: 1The processing of personal data for a purpose other than that for which they were collected is permitted if the other purpose is one of the purposes specified in Section 45, the controller is authorized to process data for this purpose and the processing is necessary and proportionate for this purpose. 2The processing of personal data for another purpose not mentioned in Section 45 is permitted if it is provided for in a legal regulation.

f02f975f-0d42-4ef7-9078-ea328538215d.content: Processing for archiving, scientific and statistical purposes

p_3.cpt_2.art_50.pt_1.content: 1Personal data may be processed in archival, scientific or statistical form within the scope of the purposes specified in Section 45 if there is a public interest in doing so and appropriate safeguards are provided for the legal interests of the data subjects. 2 Such safeguards may consist of anonymizing the personal data as soon as possible, taking precautions against unauthorized access by third parties or processing the data separately from other specialist tasks in terms of location and organization.

p_3.cpt_2.art_51.pt_1.content: Insofar as the processing of personal data can be carried out on the basis of consent in accordance with a legal provision, the controller must be able to prove the consent of the data subject.

p_3.cpt_2.art_51.pt_2.content: If the data subject's consent is given by means of a written declaration that also concerns other matters, the request for consent must be made in an understandable and easily accessible form in clear and simple language in such a way that it can be clearly distinguished from the other matters.

pt_3.content: The data subject has the right to withdraw their consent at any time. The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal. The data subject must be informed of this before consent is given.

pt_4.content: Consent is only effective if it is based on the free decision of the data subject. When assessing whether consent has been freely given, the circumstances in which it was given must be taken into account. The data subject must be informed of the intended purpose of the processing. If this is necessary in the circumstances of the individual case or if the data subject requests it, he or she must also be informed of the consequences of refusing consent.

p_3.cpt_2.art_51.pt_5.content: If special categories of personal data are processed, the consent must explicitly refer to these data.

45e8e7dd-1250-4d23-94b5-c5841884ee03.content: Processing on the instructions of the controller

p_3.cpt_2.art_52.pt_1.content: Any person subordinate to a controller or processor who has access to personal data may only process this data on the instructions of the controller, unless they are required to do so by law.

p_3.cpt_2.art_53.pt_1.content: 1Persons involved in data processing may not process personal data without authorization (data secrecy). 2They shall be obliged to maintain data secrecy when taking up their duties. 3Data secrecy shall continue to exist after the termination of their activity.

p_3.cpt_2.art_54.pt_1.content: A decision based solely on automated processing which produces an adverse legal effect concerning the data subject or significantly affects him or her shall be permitted only if provided for by law.

p_3.cpt_2.art_54.pt_2.content: Decisions pursuant to paragraph 1 may not be based on special categories of personal data unless appropriate measures have been taken to protect the legal interests and legitimate interests of the data subjects.

p_3.cpt_2.art_54.pt_3.content: Profiling that has the effect of discriminating against data subjects on the basis of special categories of personal data is prohibited.

p_3.cpt_3.art_55.pt_1.content: the purposes of the processing carried out by it,

p_3.cpt_3.art_55.pt_2.content: the rights of data subjects to information, rectification, erasure and restriction of processing with regard to the processing of their personal data,

p_3.cpt_3.art_55.pt_3.content: the name and contact details of the controller and the data protection officer,

p_3.cpt_3.art_55.pt_4.content: the right to appeal to the Federal Commissioner, and

pt_1.content: If the notification of data subjects about the processing of personal data concerning them is provided for or ordered in special legal provisions, in particular in the case of covert measures, this notification must contain at least the following information:

p_3.cpt_3.art_56.pt_1.spt_5.content: if necessary, further information, in particular if the personal data was collected without the knowledge of the data subject.

p_3.cpt_3.art_56.pt_3.content: If the notification relates to the transmission of personal data to constitution protection authorities, the Federal Intelligence Service, the Military Counter-Intelligence Service and, insofar as federal security is affected, other authorities of the Federal Ministry of Defense, it is only permissible with the consent of these bodies.

pt_4.content: In the event of a restriction pursuant to paragraph 2, paragraph 7 shall apply accordingly.

pt_1.content: The controller must provide data subjects with information on request as to whether it is processing data relating to them. Data subjects also have the right to receive information about

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_1.content: the personal data undergoing processing and the category to which they belong,

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_2.content: the available information on the origin of the data,

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_3.content: the purposes of the processing and its legal basis,

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_4.content: the recipients or categories of recipients to whom the data has been disclosed, in particular recipients in third countries or international organizations,

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_5.content: the storage period applicable to the data or, if this is not possible, the criteria for determining this period,

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_6.content: the existence of a right to rectification, erasure or restriction of processing of the data by the controller,

spt_7.content: the right to appeal to the Federal Commissioner, and

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_1.spt_8.content: Information on how to contact the Federal Commissioner.

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_2.content: Paragraph 1 shall not apply to personal data that is only processed because it may not be deleted due to statutory retention requirements, or that is used exclusively for the purposes of data backup or data protection control, if the provision of information would require a disproportionate effort and processing for other purposes is excluded by appropriate technical and organizational measures.

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_3.content: Information shall not be provided if the data subject does not provide information that would enable the data to be found and therefore the effort required to provide the information is disproportionate to the interest in information asserted by the data subject.

pt_4.content: The controller may, under the conditions of paragraph 2, refrain from providing information in accordance with paragraph 1 sentence 1 or partially or completely restrict the provision of information in accordance with paragraph 1 sentence 2.

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_5.content: If the provision of information relates to the transfer of personal data to constitution protection authorities, the Federal Intelligence Service, the Military Counter-Intelligence Service and, insofar as federal security is affected, other authorities of the Federal Ministry of Defense, it is only permissible with the consent of these bodies.

pt_6.content: The controller shall inform the data subject in writing without undue delay if the information is withheld or restricted. This shall not apply if the provision of this information would already entail a risk within the meaning of paragraph 2. The information pursuant to sentence 1 shall be substantiated, unless the communication of the reasons would jeopardize the purpose pursued with the refraining from or the restriction of the information.

pt_7.content: If the data subject is informed in accordance with paragraph 6 that the information has been withheld or restricted, he or she may also exercise his or her right to information via the Federal Commissioner. The controller shall inform the data subject of this possibility and of the fact that he or she may appeal to the Federal Commissioner or seek legal protection in court. If the data subject exercises his or her right pursuant to sentence 1, the information shall be provided to the Federal Commissioner upon request, unless the competent supreme federal authority determines in an individual case that this would jeopardize the security of the Federation or a Land. The Federal Commissioner shall at least inform the data subject that all necessary checks have been carried out or that a check has been carried out by him or her. This notification may include information as to whether data protection violations have been identified. The Federal Commissioner's notification to the data subject must not allow any conclusions to be drawn about the controller's level of knowledge unless the controller consents to further information. The controller may refuse consent only to the extent that and for as long as he or she could refrain from providing information or restrict it in accordance with paragraph 4. The Federal Commissioner shall also inform the data subject of his or her right to judicial protection.

p_3.cpt_3.art_57.pt_8.content: The controller must document the factual or legal reasons for the decision.

cab6612d-a837-4011-adab-579f9390373e.content: Rights to rectification, erasure and restriction of processing

pt_1.content: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning him or her. In particular in the case of statements or assessments, the question of accuracy does not concern the content of the statement or assessment. If the accuracy or inaccuracy of the data cannot be established, the rectification shall be replaced by a restriction of processing. In this case, the controller must inform the data subject before lifting the restriction. The data subject may also request the completion of incomplete personal data if this is appropriate, taking into account the purposes of the processing.

p_3.cpt_3.art_58.pt_2.content: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning him or her without undue delay where the processing is unlawful, the processing is no longer necessary for the performance of the task or the data must be erased for compliance with a legal obligation.

pt_3.content: Instead of erasing the personal data, the controller may restrict their processing if

p_3.cpt_3.art_58.pt_3.spt_1.content: there is reason to assume that deletion would impair the interests of a data subject worthy of protection,

spt_2.content: the data must be retained for evidentiary purposes in proceedings that serve the purposes of the or

p_3.cpt_3.art_58.pt_3.spt_3.content: deletion is not possible or only possible with disproportionate effort due to the special type of storage.

p_3.cpt_3.art_58.pt_3.spt_977fc24e-8796-.content: 2Data whose processing is restricted in accordance with sentence 1 may only be processed for the purpose that prevented their erasure.

p_3.cpt_3.art_58.pt_4.content: In the case of automated file systems, it must be technically ensured that a restriction of processing is clearly recognizable and that processing for other purposes is not possible without further verification.

pt_5.content: Where the controller has made a rectification, the controller shall communicate this rectification to any party which has previously transmitted the personal data to the controller. In cases of rectification, erasure or restriction of processing pursuant to paragraphs 1 to 3, the controller shall notify recipients to whom the data have been disclosed of these measures. The recipient shall rectify, erase or restrict the processing of the data.

pt_6.content: The controller shall inform the data subject in writing of any decision not to rectify or erase personal data or to restrict processing instead. This shall not apply if the provision of this information alone would entail a risk within the meaning of paragraph 2. The notification pursuant to sentence 1 shall be substantiated, unless the communication of the reasons would jeopardize the purpose pursued by refraining from providing the information.

b49f854e-40a2-43d1-a39f-91e06d88d7ff.content: Procedure for exercising the rights of the data subject

p_3.cpt_3.art_59.pt_1.content: The controller must communicate with data subjects using clear and simple language in a precise, comprehensible and easily accessible form. Without prejudice to any special formal requirements, the controller should always use the form chosen for the request when responding to requests.

pt_2.content: In the case of requests, the controller shall, without prejudice to paragraph 6 and paragraph 6, immediately inform the data subject in writing of the procedure followed.

pt_3.content: The provision of information in accordance with , the notifications in accordance with §§ and and the processing of requests in accordance with §§ and shall be free of charge. In the case of manifestly unfounded or excessive requests pursuant to §§ and , the controller may either charge a reasonable fee based on the administrative costs or refuse to act on the request. In this case, the controller must be able to prove the manifestly unfounded or excessive nature of the request.

pt_4.content: If the controller has reasonable doubts about the identity of a data subject who has made a request pursuant to §§ or , he may request additional information from the data subject which is necessary to confirm his identity.

pt_1.content: Without prejudice to any other legal remedies, any data subject may lodge a complaint with the Federal Commissioner if he or she considers that his or her rights have been infringed as a result of the processing of his or her personal data by public authorities for the purposes set out above. This does not apply to the processing of personal data by courts insofar as they have processed the data in the course of their judicial activities. The Federal Commissioner shall inform the data subject of the status and outcome of the complaint and inform him or her of the possibility of judicial redress.

p_3.cpt_3.art_60.pt_2.content: The Federal Commissioner shall forward a complaint lodged with him or her about processing that falls within the competence of a supervisory authority in another Member State of the European Union to the competent supervisory authority of the other state without delay. In this case, he or she shall inform the data subject of the forwarding and provide further assistance at the data subject's request.

0c1d022d-b0a7-4fd9-90c2-7e53d2e799a7.content: Legal protection against decisions of the Federal Commissioner or in the event of his or her failure to act

p_3.cpt_3.art_61.pt_1.content: Without prejudice to other legal remedies, any natural or legal person may take legal action against a binding decision of the Federal Commissioner.

pt_2.content: Paragraph 1 shall apply accordingly in favor of data subjects if the Federal Commissioner has not dealt with a complaint or has not informed the data subject of the status or outcome of the complaint within three months of the complaint being lodged.

bb82ec6d-7457-401d-bbbf-624a78dd4a07.content: Obligations of those responsible and processors

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_1.content: If personal data is processed by other persons or bodies on behalf of a controller, the controller must ensure compliance with the provisions of this Act and other data protection regulations. In this case, the rights of data subjects to information, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing and compensation must be asserted against the controller.

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_2.content: A controller may only commission processors with the processing of personal data who take appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure that the processing is carried out in accordance with the legal requirements and that the rights of the data subjects are protected.

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_3.content: Processors may not involve any other processors without the prior written consent of the controller. If the controller has granted the processor general permission to involve other processors, the processor must inform the controller of any intended involvement or replacement. In this case, the controller may prohibit the involvement or replacement.

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_4.content: If a processor engages another processor, it shall impose the same obligations under its contract with the controller pursuant to paragraph 5 as apply to the controller, unless these obligations are already binding on the other processor under other provisions. If an additional processor does not fulfill these obligations, the processor commissioning it shall be liable to the controller for compliance with the obligations of the additional processor.

pt_5.content: Processing by a processor shall be based on a contract or other legal instrument which binds the processor to the controller and which specifies the subject matter, duration, nature and purpose of the processing, the type of personal data, the categories of data subjects and the rights and obligations of the controller. In particular, the contract or other legal instrument shall provide that the processor shall

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_5.spt_1.content: only acts on the documented instructions of the controller; if the processor is of the opinion that an instruction is unlawful, it must inform the controller immediately;

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_5.spt_2.content: ensures that the persons authorized to process the personal data are bound to confidentiality, unless they are subject to an appropriate statutory duty of confidentiality;

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_5.spt_3.content: supports the controller by appropriate means to ensure compliance with the provisions on the rights of the data subject;

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_5.spt_4.content: returns or deletes all personal data after completion of the provision of the processing services at the discretion of the controller and destroys existing copies, unless there is a legal obligation to store the data;

spt_5.content: provides the controller with all necessary information, in particular the protocols drawn up in accordance with the above, to demonstrate compliance with its obligations;

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_5.spt_6.content: enables and contributes to audits carried out by the person responsible or an auditor appointed by him;

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_5.spt_7.content: complies with the conditions set out in paragraphs 3 and 4 for the use of the services of another processor;

spt_9.content: taking into account the nature of the processing and the information available to him, supports the controller in complying with the obligations set out in §§ to and .

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_6.content: The contract within the meaning of paragraph 5 must be drawn up in writing or electronically.

p_3.cpt_4.art_62.pt_7.content: A processor who determines the purposes and means of processing in breach of this provision shall be considered a controller in relation to that processing.

p_3.cpt_4.art_63.pt_1.content: If two or more controllers jointly determine the purposes and means of processing, they are considered joint controllers. Joint controllers must define their respective tasks and responsibilities under data protection law in a transparent manner in an agreement, unless these are already laid down in legal provisions. In particular, the agreement must specify who has to comply with which information obligations and how and against whom data subjects can exercise their rights. A corresponding agreement does not prevent the data subject from asserting their rights against each of the joint controllers.

15f46430-caa1-41aa-a22d-da473601b27d.content: Requirements for the security of data processing

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_1.content: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation, the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the likelihood and severity of the risk to the legal interests of data subjects posed by the processing, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk when processing personal data, in particular with regard to the processing of special categories of personal data. In doing so, the controller must take into account the relevant technical guidelines and recommendations of the Federal Office for Information Security.

pt_2.content: The measures referred to in paragraph 1 may include, inter alia, the pseudonymization and encryption of personal data where such means are feasible in view of the purposes of the processing. The measures referred to in paragraph 1 shall result in

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_2.spt_1.content: the confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of the systems and services in connection with the processing are ensured in the long term and

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_2.spt_2.content: the availability of personal data and access to it can be restored quickly in the event of a physical or technical incident.

pt_3.content: In the case of automated processing, the controller and the processor shall, following a risk assessment, take measures to achieve the following:

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_1.content: Denying unauthorized persons access to processing equipment used for processing (access control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_2.content: Prevention of unauthorized reading, copying, modification or deletion of data carriers (data carrier control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_3.content: Preventing the unauthorized input of personal data and the unauthorized access, modification and deletion of stored personal data (storage control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_4.content: Preventing the use of automated processing systems with the help of data transmission devices by unauthorized persons (user control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_5.content: Ensuring that those authorized to use an automated processing system only have access to the personal data covered by their access authorization (access control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_6.content: Ensuring that it is possible to verify and establish to which bodies personal data have been or can be transmitted or made available by means of data transmission equipment (transmission control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_7.content: Ensuring that it is subsequently possible to check and determine which personal data has been entered or changed in automated processing systems, at what time and by whom (input control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_8.content: Ensuring that the confidentiality and integrity of data is protected during the transmission of personal data and the transportation of data carriers (transport control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_9.content: Guarantee that deployed systems can be restored in the event of a fault (recoverability),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_10.content: Ensuring that all system functions are available and that any malfunctions are reported (reliability),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_11.content: Ensuring that stored personal data cannot be damaged by system malfunctions (data integrity),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_12.content: Ensuring that personal data processed on behalf of the client can only be processed in accordance with the client's instructions (order control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_13.content: Ensuring that personal data is protected against destruction or loss (availability control),

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_14.content: Ensuring that personal data collected for different purposes can be processed separately (separability).

p_3.cpt_4.art_64.pt_3.spt_ca4b0b6d-004f-.content: A purpose in accordance with sentence 1 numbers 2 to 5 can be achieved in particular through the use of state-of-the-art encryption methods.

f28582a0-654f-4466-873f-d4bc444a886d.content: Reporting personal data breaches to the Federal Commissioner

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_1.content: The controller shall notify the Federal Commissioner of a personal data breach without undue delay and, where feasible, within 72 hours of becoming aware of it, unless the breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the legal interests of natural persons. If the report to the Federal Commissioner is not made within 72 hours, the delay must be justified.

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_2.content: A processor must report a personal data breach to the controller without delay.

pt_3.content: The notification in accordance with paragraph 1 must contain at least the following information:

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_3.spt_1.content: a description of the nature of the personal data breach, including, where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned, the categories of personal data concerned and the approximate number of personal data records concerned,

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_3.spt_2.content: the name and contact details of the data protection officer or another person or body that can provide further information,

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_3.spt_3.content: a description of the probable consequences of the injury and

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_3.spt_4.content: a description of the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the breach and measures taken to mitigate its possible adverse effects.

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_4.content: If the information referred to in paragraph 3 cannot be submitted together with the notification, the controller shall submit it as soon as it is available.

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_5.content: The controller must document personal data breaches. The documentation must include all facts related to the incidents, their effects and the remedial measures taken.

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_6.content: Insofar as a personal data breach affects personal data transmitted by or to a controller in another Member State of the European Union, the information referred to in paragraph 3 shall be transmitted to the controller in that Member State without undue delay.

p_3.cpt_4.art_65.pt_8.content: Further obligations of the controller to notify personal data breaches remain unaffected.

00dcc945-d39a-4348-be5c-1cb2ffa24ecf.content: Notification of data subjects in the event of personal data breaches

p_3.cpt_4.art_66.pt_1.content: If a personal data breach is likely to result in a significant risk to the legal interests of data subjects, the controller must notify the data subjects of the incident without delay.

pt_2.content: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall describe in clear and plain language the nature of the personal data breach and contain at least the information and measures referred to in paragraph 3(2) to (4).

pt_3.content: Notification in accordance with paragraph 1 may be waived if

p_3.cpt_4.art_66.pt_3.spt_1.content: the controller has taken appropriate technical and organizational security measures and these measures have been applied to the data affected by the personal data breach; this applies in particular to measures such as encryption that make the data inaccessible to unauthorized persons;

p_3.cpt_4.art_66.pt_3.spt_2.content: the controller has ensured by measures taken following the breach that in all probability there is no longer a significant risk within the meaning of paragraph 1, or

p_3.cpt_4.art_66.pt_3.spt_3.content: this would involve a disproportionate effort; in this case, a public announcement or similar measure must be made instead, through which the persons concerned are informed in a comparably effective manner.

p_3.cpt_4.art_66.pt_4.content: If the controller has not notified the data subjects of a personal data breach, the Federal Commissioner may formally determine that, in his or her opinion, the conditions referred to in paragraph 3 have not been met. In doing so, he or she shall take into account the likelihood that the breach will result in a significant risk within the meaning of paragraph 1.

pt_5.content: The notification of the persons concerned in accordance with paragraph 1 may be postponed, restricted or omitted under the conditions specified in paragraph 2, unless the interests of the person concerned outweigh the interests of the person concerned due to the significant risk posed by the violation within the meaning of paragraph 1.

088c1d3a-26f3-437c-9531-732892682f55.content: Carrying out a data protection impact assessment

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_1.content: If a form of processing, in particular when using new technologies, is likely to result in a significant risk to the legal interests of data subjects due to the nature, scope, circumstances and purposes of the processing, the controller must carry out an assessment of the consequences of the intended processing operations for the data subjects in advance.

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_2.content: A joint data protection impact assessment can be carried out to examine several similar processing operations with a similarly high risk potential.

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_3.content: The controller must involve the data protection officer in carrying out the impact assessment.

pt_4.content: The impact assessment must take into account the rights of the data subjects affected by the processing and contain at least the following:

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_4.spt_1.content: a systematic description of the planned processing operations and the purposes of the processing,

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_4.spt_2.content: an assessment of the necessity and proportionality of the processing operations in relation to their purpose,

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_4.spt_3.content: an assessment of the risks to the legal interests of the persons concerned and

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_4.spt_4.content: the measures taken to address existing risks, including safeguards, security measures and procedures to ensure the protection of personal data and to demonstrate compliance with legal requirements.

p_3.cpt_4.art_67.pt_5.content: If necessary, the controller must check whether the processing complies with the requirements resulting from the impact assessment.

p_3.cpt_4.art_68.pt_1.content: The controller shall cooperate with the Federal Commissioner in the performance of his or her duties.

pt_1.content: The controller must consult the Federal Commissioner before commissioning new file systems to be created if

spt_1.content: it is apparent from a data protection impact assessment that the processing would result in a significant risk to the legal interests of the data subjects if the controller were not to take remedial action, or

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_1.spt_2.content: the form of processing, in particular when using new technologies, mechanisms or procedures, results in a significant risk to the legal interests of the data subjects.

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_1.spt_f2bfc4d5-2024-.content: The Federal Commissioner may draw up a list of the processing operations that are subject to the obligation to consult pursuant to sentence 1.

pt_2.content: In the case of paragraph 1, the data shall be submitted to the Federal Commissioner:

spt_1.content: the data protection impact assessment carried out,

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_2.spt_2.content: where applicable, information on the respective responsibilities of the controller, joint controllers and processors involved in the processing,

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_2.spt_3.content: Information on the purposes and means of the intended processing,

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_2.spt_4.content: information on the measures and safeguards envisaged to protect the legal interests of the data subjects; and

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_2.spt_5.content: Name and contact details of the data protection officer.

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_2.spt_3a755af8-6401-.content: Upon request, he or she shall also be provided with any other information necessary to assess the lawfulness of the processing and, in particular, the risks and safeguards relating to the protection of the personal data of the data subjects.

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_3.content: If the Federal Commissioner is of the opinion that the planned processing would violate legal requirements, in particular because the controller has not sufficiently identified the risk or has not taken sufficient remedial measures, he or she may submit written recommendations to the controller and, if applicable, the processor within a period of six weeks after the initiation of the consultation as to which measures should still be taken. The Federal Commissioner may extend this period by one month if the planned processing is particularly complex. In this case, he or she must inform the controller and, where applicable, the processor of the extension of the deadline within one month of initiating the hearing.

p_3.cpt_4.art_69.pt_4.content: If the intended processing is of considerable importance for the performance of the controller's tasks and is therefore particularly urgent, the controller may commence the processing after the start of the consultation but before the expiry of the period referred to in paragraph 3 sentence 1. In this case, the recommendations of the Federal Commissioner shall be taken into account retrospectively and the type and manner of processing shall be adapted accordingly if necessary.

pt_1.content: The controller shall keep a record of all categories of processing activities for which it is responsible. This register must contain the following information:

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_1.content: the name and contact details of the controller and, where applicable, the joint controller and the name and contact details of the data protection officer,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_3.content: the categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been or will be disclosed,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_4.content: a description of the categories of data subjects and the categories of personal data,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_5.content: the use of profiling where appropriate,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_6.content: where applicable, the categories of transfers of personal data to bodies in a third country or to an international organization,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_7.content: Information on the legal basis of the processing,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_1.spt_8.content: the envisaged time limits for erasure or verification of the need to store the different categories of personal data, and

spt_9.content: a general description of the technical and organizational measures in accordance with .

pt_2.content: The processor must keep a record of all categories of processing that it carries out on behalf of a controller, which must include the following:

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_2.spt_1.content: the name and contact details of the processor, of each controller on whose behalf the processor is acting and, where applicable, of the data protection officer,

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_2.spt_2.content: where appropriate, transfers of personal data to bodies in a third country or to an international organization, specifying the country or organization, and

spt_3.content: a general description of the technical and organizational measures in accordance with .

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_3.content: The registers referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be kept in writing or electronically.

p_3.cpt_4.art_70.pt_4.content: Controllers and processors must make their directories available to the Federal Commissioner upon request.

c01ee0cc-997a-4a6d-9527-a30b08b2d016.content: Data protection through technology design and data protection-friendly default settings

p_3.cpt_4.art_71.pt_1.content: The controller shall, both at the time of the determination of the means for processing and at the time of the processing itself, implement appropriate safeguards which are suitable to effectively implement the data protection principles, such as data minimization, and which ensure that the legal requirements are complied with and the rights of the data subjects are protected. In doing so, it must take into account the state of the art, the implementation costs and the nature, scope, circumstances and purposes of the processing as well as the varying likelihood and severity of the risks associated with the processing for the legal interests of the data subjects. In particular, the processing of personal data and the selection and design of data processing systems must be geared towards the goal of processing as little personal data as possible. Personal data must be anonymized or pseudonymized at the earliest possible stage, insofar as this is possible in accordance with the purpose of processing.

p_3.cpt_4.art_71.pt_2.content: The controller must take appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure that, by default, only those personal data can be processed whose processing is necessary for the respective specific processing purpose. This applies to the amount of data collected, the scope of its processing, its storage period and its accessibility. In particular, the measures must ensure that the data cannot be automatically made accessible to an indefinite number of persons by default.

164009cc-b5a6-443d-9653-0027086abe4d.content: Distinction between different categories of affected persons

p_3.cpt_4.art_72.pt_1.content: Persons against whom there is reasonable suspicion that they have committed a criminal offense,

p_3.cpt_4.art_72.pt_2.content: Persons against whom there is reasonable suspicion that they will commit a criminal offense in the near future,

p_3.cpt_4.art_72.pt_4.content: victims of a criminal offense or persons for whom certain facts indicate that they could be victims of a criminal offense, and

p_3.cpt_4.art_72.pt_5.content: other persons such as, in particular, witnesses, whistleblowers or persons who are in contact or connected with the persons named in numbers 1 to 4.

p_3.cpt_4.art_72.pt_6.content: When processing personal data, the controller must distinguish as far as possible between the different categories of data subjects. This applies in particular to the following categories:

a054b0d3-d0d7-41a8-9e52-9b85edbf2534.content: Distinguishing between facts and personal assessments

p_3.cpt_4.art_73.pt_1.content: When processing personal data, the controller must distinguish as far as possible between personal data based on facts and personal assessments. For this purpose, the controller shall, as far as possible and appropriate in the context of the particular processing, identify assessments based on personal evaluations as such. It must also be possible to determine which body maintains the documents on which the assessment based on a personal evaluation is based.

p_3.cpt_4.art_74.pt_1.content: The controller shall take reasonable steps to ensure that personal data which are inaccurate or no longer up to date are not transmitted or otherwise made available. To this end, the controller shall, as far as reasonably possible, verify the quality of the data before transmitting or making it available. For each transmission of personal data, he must also, as far as possible and appropriate, include information that allows the recipient to assess the accuracy, completeness and reliability of the data and whether it is up to date.

p_3.cpt_4.art_74.pt_2.content: If special conditions apply to the processing of personal data, the transmitting body must inform the recipient of these conditions and the obligation to comply with them when transmitting data. The obligation to inform can be fulfilled by marking the data accordingly.

pt_3.content: The transferring body shall not apply to recipients in other Member States of the European Union and to bodies, offices and agencies established pursuant to Chapters 4 and 5 of Title V of Part Three of the that do not also apply to corresponding domestic data transfers.

bdc7fc2c-faa6-42af-b2cd-97ac573dbfd1.content: Correction and deletion of personal data and restriction of processing

p_3.cpt_4.art_75.pt_1.content: The controller must rectify personal data if it is incorrect.

p_3.cpt_4.art_75.pt_2.content: The data controller must delete personal data immediately if its processing is unlawful, if it must be deleted to fulfill a legal obligation or if knowledge of it is no longer required for the performance of its tasks.

pt_3.content: Paragraphs 3 to 5 shall apply accordingly. If incorrect personal data or personal data have been transmitted unlawfully, the recipient must also be informed of this.

p_3.cpt_4.art_75.pt_4.content: Without prejudice to any maximum retention or erasure periods laid down by law, the controller shall provide for appropriate time limits for the erasure of personal data or for a regular review of the need to store them, and shall ensure by procedural means that these time limits are complied with.

pt_1.content: In automated processing systems, controllers and processors must log at least the following processing operations:

p_3.cpt_4.art_76.pt_2.content: The logs of requests and disclosures must make it possible to establish the justification, date and time of these operations and, as far as possible, the identity of the person who requested or disclosed the personal data and the identity of the recipient of the data.

p_3.cpt_4.art_76.pt_3.content: The logs may only be used to verify the lawfulness of data processing by the Data Protection Officer, the Federal Commissioner and the data subject, for self-monitoring, to ensure the integrity and security of personal data and for criminal proceedings.

p_3.cpt_4.art_76.pt_4.content: The log data must be deleted at the end of the year following its generation.

p_3.cpt_4.art_76.pt_5.content: The controller and the processor shall make the logs available to the Federal Commissioner upon request.

p_3.cpt_4.art_77.pt_1.content: The controller must ensure that confidential reports on breaches of data protection regulations occurring in its area of responsibility can be forwarded to it.

aa504336-a331-4919-a1fe-6e6ee712535b.content: Data transfers to third countries and international organisations

pt_1.content: The transfer of personal data to bodies in third countries or to international organizations is permitted if the other conditions applicable to data transfers are met, if

spt_1.content: the body or international organization is responsible for the purposes mentioned in and

spt_2.content: the European Commission has taken an adequacy decision in accordance with Article 36(3) of the Directive.

p_3.cpt_5.art_78.pt_2.content: The transfer of personal data shall not take place despite the existence of an adequacy decision within the meaning of paragraph 1 number 2 and the public interest in the data transfer to be taken into account if, in the individual case, the recipient does not sufficiently ensure that the data is handled in a manner that is appropriate under data protection law and respects fundamental human rights or if there are otherwise overriding interests of a data subject worthy of protection. In its assessment, the controller must take into account whether the recipient guarantees adequate protection of the transferred data in the individual case

p_3.cpt_5.art_78.pt_3.content: Where personal data transferred or made available from another Member State of the European Union are to be transferred in accordance with paragraph 1, such transfer shall be subject to prior authorization by the competent authority of the other Member State. Transfers without prior authorization shall only be permitted if the transfer is necessary to prevent an immediate and serious threat to public security of a State or to the essential interests of a Member State and the prior authorization cannot be obtained in time. In the case of sentence 2, the authority of the other Member State which would have been responsible for granting the authorization shall be informed of the transfer without delay.

p_3.cpt_5.art_78.pt_4.content: The controller who transfers data pursuant to paragraph 1 shall take appropriate measures to ensure that the recipient does not further transfer the transferred data to other third countries or other international organizations unless the controller has given prior authorization for such transfer. In deciding whether to grant the authorization, the controller shall take into account all relevant factors, in particular the seriousness of the offence, the purpose of the initial transfer and the level of protection of personal data in the third country or international organization to which the data are to be onward transferred. Authorization may only be granted if a direct transfer to the other third country or international organization would also be permissible. The responsibility for granting the authorization can also be regulated differently.

pt_1.content: If, contrary to paragraph 1 number 2, there is no decision pursuant to Article 36(3) of the Directive, a transfer is also permitted if the other conditions of the Directive are met if

p_3.cpt_5.art_79.pt_1.spt_1.content: appropriate safeguards for the protection of personal data are provided for in a legally binding instrument, or

p_3.cpt_5.art_79.pt_1.spt_2.content: the controller, having assessed all the circumstances surrounding the transfer, considers that appropriate safeguards exist for the protection of personal data.

p_3.cpt_5.art_79.pt_2.content: The controller shall document transfers in accordance with paragraph 1 number 2. The documentation shall include the time of the transfer, the identity of the recipient, the reason for the transfer and the personal data transferred. It shall be made available to the Federal Commissioner upon request.

p_3.cpt_5.art_79.pt_3.content: The controller shall inform the Federal Commissioner at least once a year about transfers that have taken place on the basis of an assessment pursuant to paragraph 1 number 2. In the notification, the controller may appropriately categorize the recipients and the purposes of the transfer.

pt_1.content: If, contrary to paragraph 1 point 2, there is no decision pursuant to Article 36(3) of the Directive and there are no appropriate safeguards within the meaning of paragraph 1, a transfer is also permitted if the other conditions of the Directive are met and if the transfer is necessary

p_3.cpt_5.art_80.pt_1.spt_1.content: to protect the vital interests of a natural person,

p_3.cpt_5.art_80.pt_1.spt_2.content: to protect the legitimate interests of the data subject,

p_3.cpt_5.art_80.pt_1.spt_3.content: to avert a present and substantial danger to the public security of a state,

spt_4.content: in individual cases for the purposes mentioned in or

spt_5.content: in individual cases for the assertion, exercise or defense of legal claims in connection with the purposes mentioned in

p_3.cpt_5.art_80.pt_2.content: The controller shall refrain from a transfer pursuant to paragraph 1 if the fundamental rights of the data subject outweigh the public interest in the transfer.

pt_3.content: Paragraph 2 shall apply accordingly to transmissions pursuant to paragraph 1.

1b4a19bf-7be9-4ddc-a3f3-346122650d30.content: Other data transfers to recipients in third countries

pt_1.content: If the other conditions for the transfer of data to third countries are met, data controllers may, in specific individual cases, transfer personal data directly to bodies in third countries not mentioned in paragraph 1 number 1 if the transfer is absolutely necessary for the performance of their tasks and

p_3.cpt_5.art_81.pt_1.spt_1.content: in the specific case, no fundamental rights of the data subject outweigh the public interest in a transfer,

spt_2.content: the transmission to the bodies referred to in paragraph 1(1) would be ineffective or inappropriate, in particular because it cannot be carried out in good time, and

p_3.cpt_5.art_81.pt_1.spt_3.content: the controller informs the recipient of the purposes of the processing and informs the recipient that the transferred data may only be processed to the extent necessary for these purposes.

pt_2.content: In the case of paragraph 1, the controller shall inform the bodies referred to in paragraph 1(1) of the transfer without delay, unless this is ineffective or inappropriate.

pt_3.content: Paragraphs 2 and 3 shall apply accordingly to transmissions pursuant to paragraph 1.

p_3.cpt_5.art_81.pt_4.content: In the case of transfers pursuant to paragraph 1, the controller shall oblige the recipient to process the personal data transferred without the recipient's consent only for the purpose for which they were transferred.

p_3.cpt_5.art_81.pt_5.content: Agreements in the area of judicial cooperation in criminal matters and police cooperation remain unaffected.

pt_1.content: The Federal Commissioner shall provide information and administrative assistance to the data protection supervisory authorities in other Member States of the European Union to the extent necessary for the uniform implementation and application of the Directive. Administrative assistance relates in particular to requests for information and supervisory measures, such as requests for consultation or for the performance of inspections and investigations.

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_2.content: The Federal Commissioner shall take all appropriate measures to comply with requests for assistance without delay and at the latest within one month of receipt.

pt_3.content: The Federal Commissioner may only refuse requests for administrative assistance if

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_3.spt_1.content: he or she is not responsible for the subject matter of the request or for the measures he or she is to carry out, or

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_3.spt_2.content: responding to the request would violate legal provisions.

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_4.content: The Federal Commissioner shall inform the requesting supervisory authority of the other state of the results or, where applicable, of the progress of the measures taken to comply with the request for assistance. In the case of paragraph 3, he or she shall explain the reasons for refusing the request.

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_5.content: As a rule, the Federal Commissioner shall transmit the information requested by the supervisory authority of the other state electronically and in a standardized format.

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_6.content: The Federal Commissioner shall execute requests for administrative assistance free of charge, unless he or she has agreed with the supervisory authority of the other state to reimburse expenses incurred in individual cases.

p_3.cpt_6.art_82.pt_7.content: A request for assistance from the Federal Commissioner shall contain all necessary information; this includes in particular the purpose of and reasons for the request. The information provided in response to the request may only be used for the purpose for which it was requested.

p_3.cpt_7.art_83.pt_1.content: If a controller has caused damage to a data subject by processing personal data that was unlawful under this Act or under other provisions applicable to the processing of personal data, the controller or its legal entity shall be liable to compensate the data subject for the damage. The obligation to pay compensation does not apply if, in the case of non-automated processing, the damage is not attributable to the fault of the controller.

p_3.cpt_7.art_83.pt_2.content: The person concerned can demand appropriate monetary compensation for damage that is not financial loss.

p_3.cpt_7.art_83.pt_3.content: If, in the case of automated processing of personal data, it is not possible to determine which of several controllers involved caused the damage, each controller or its legal entity is liable.

pt_4.content: If the person concerned was at fault when the damage occurred, this shall apply accordingly.

p_3.cpt_7.art_83.pt_5.content: The statute of limitations provisions of the German Civil Code applicable to tortious acts shall apply accordingly.

p_3.cpt_7.art_84.pt_1.content: Section 42 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the processing of personal data by public bodies in the context of activities pursuant to Section 45 sentences 1, 3 or 4.

Part 4 – Special provisions for processing within the scope of activities not covered by
  Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Directive (EU)2016/680

95438597-7224-49a8-9dbb-e74d83a323f9.content: Processing of personal data in the context of activities not falling within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and Directive (EU) 2016/680

pt_1.content: The transfer of personal data to a third country or to supranational or intergovernmental bodies or international organizations in the context of activities not falling within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the Directive is also permitted, in addition to the cases already permitted under Regulation (EU) 2016/679, if it is necessary for the performance of own tasks for imperative reasons of defense or for the fulfillment of supranational or intergovernmental obligations of a public body of the Federal Government in the field of crisis management or conflict prevention or for humanitarian measures. The recipient must be informed that the transmitted data may only be used for the purpose for which it was transmitted.

pt_2.content: Paragraph 4 shall not apply to processing in the context of activities not falling within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the Directive by departments within the remit of the Federal Ministry of Defence if the Federal Ministry of Defence determines in individual cases that compliance with the obligations set out therein would jeopardize the security of the Federal Government.

pt_3.content: There is no obligation to provide information in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 for processing in the context of activities by federal public bodies that do not fall within the scope of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the Directive if

spt_1.content: the cases referred to in paragraph 1 numbers 1 to 3, or

p_4.art_85.pt_3.spt_2.content: its fulfillment would disclose information that must be kept secret in accordance with a legal provision or by its nature, in particular because of the overriding legitimate interests of a third party, and therefore the interest of the data subject in the disclosure of the information must take precedence.

p_4.art_85.pt_3.spt_a2efd119-2ae0-4049-b.content: 2If the data subject is not to be informed in the cases of sentence 1, there is also no right to information. 3 Section 32 (2) and Section 33 (2) shall not apply.

e934a98c-6732-41fd-a183-b6fcf2543e9b.content: Processing of personal data for the purposes of state awards and honors

pt_1.content: In order to prepare and carry out state procedures for awards and honors, both the competent and other public and non-public bodies may process the personal data required for this purpose, including special categories of personal data within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, even without the knowledge of the person concerned. Paragraph 8 applies accordingly to non-public bodies. Processing of personal data in accordance with sentence 1 for other purposes is only permitted with the consent of the data subject.

pt_2.content: If processing is carried out exclusively for the purposes mentioned in paragraph 1 sentence 1, the provisions up to , and of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 shall not apply.

pt_3.content: Where special categories of personal data referred to in paragraph 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 are processed, the controller shall implement suitable and specific measures to safeguard the data subject's rights referred to in paragraph 2.
